Kenga lives in Changamwe near Mombasa Kenya. For more than ten years he has been selling charcoal in his neighborhood. He knew Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy sacks of charcoal for resale. He has an ambition of having five charcoal outlets where he will be able to reach the maximum number of customers. 

At the end of the loan term he expects to be able to pay his children's school fees and also improve the standards of living of his family. The challenge in this business is the weather. During rainy seasons it is difficult to get charcoal and if you get it, it is very expensive which cuts his income.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Divinah

texts.en: Divinah is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 7 to 18 years. She describes herself as hopeful. She operates a tailoring shop where she repairs clothes and makes clothes to sell. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of materials. She will use this 25,000 KES loan buy tailoring materials like cloth sheets, thread and other items. She hopes that in the future she will be able to feed and educate her children comfortably. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 10,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy tailoring materials like cloth sheets, thread and other items.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man who describes himself as committed. For the past four years, he had operated a general shop where he sells foodstuffs, detergent, and beverages. Patrick's business is located in a convenient area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate capital to expand. 

Patrick is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy  more rice to sell. This will be his second loan with SMEP DTM and he successfully repaid his previous 20,000 KES loan. Patrick's business goal is to open another store within five years and he hopes that, in the future, he will be self-reliant.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as aggressive. Peris operates a boutique where she sells shoes, trousers, dresses, and skirts. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a suitable area and her primary customers are mostly ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds to expand. 

Peris will use this KES 15,000 loan to add stock of dresses, shoes, and skirts for resale. Her business goal is to be well established within five years. She hopes that in the future she will benefit fully from her business.

loans.use: to add stock of dresses, shoes, and skirts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, maize and beans and also renovate his cafeteria.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is divorced and has nine children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Efua is a successful businesswoman. She sells soft drinks in Emina (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about two years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Efua uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Efua will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Although she received no prior formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling doughnuts in Elmina (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Adjoa is married and has four children. Her husband works as a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Adjoa wants to use this loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of doughnuts. In the long term, Adjoa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to buy increased ingredients to make her tasty doughnuts

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Elmina (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 40 years. 

Ekua is married and has ten children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Ekua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Ekua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She runs a cafeteria. This is what she has done for the last fifteen years. She is a married woman blessed with four children all of whom attend school. She has one employee in her business. She wanted credit to help her run her business and this led her to the Milango offices. 

She now seeks a loan to buy bags of maize, beans, tea and flour. Her husband is employed and this is an additional income for the family. She intends to open another cafe in town in the course of the next five years. The major challenges that she faces in this business is the unpredictable weather and that the municipal council keeps disturbing things from time to time. The income she will raise from the loan will help her pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize, beans, tea and flour.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine lives in Kongowea, Kenya. For the last three years, she has been buying and selling second-hand clothes. She is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She now seeks a loan to purchase second-hand clothing for resale. The major challenges she faces are competition from other traders and price changes. The income she will raise from the loan will help her pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en: Sanita sell charcoal in the Kongowea area where she also lives. This has been her business for the last four years. She learned about Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy ten sacks of charcoal for resale. She says that the challenge she is facing is that the grace period to start repaying the loan is so small. The loan will help to pay school fees for her children and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a single woman who describes herself to be God-fearing. For the past three years, she has operated a shoe shop. Pauline's business is located in a busy area with many potential customers. Her biggest business challenge is inadequate capital to expand. 

Pauline is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy stocks of shoes for resale. This will be her second loan with SMEP DTM and she successfully repaid her previous 20,000 KES loan. Pauline's business goal is to operate more than two businesses within five years and she hope that, in the future, she will be able to import shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita wants to buy a milk cow from a good breed - the same breed as the one in the photograph that produces 35-40 kg milk per day with the right care and food.

Anita is 38 years old and has four children ranging in age from 12 to 21, all of whom go to school. Livestock activity is the type of business Anita has been practicing for the past ten years and it has turned out to be profitable, according to her.

"I have been able to generate an income by selling the milk to a close by dairy farm. That’s not a little thing. I can’t imagine what I would have done without this activity and income," Anita said.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en:
Edmond wants to buy corn and bean seeds for planting and he needs lenders’ help to accomplish this goal. The land in the background of the photograph is the planting land he owns that has turned out to be very fertile, according to Edmond.

Edmond is 38 and he lives together with his three-year-old child, his wife, and their extended family from both sides in south-eastern Albania. For the last six years, Edmond has been enjoying the agriculture/livestock sort of business activity and has been selling fresh produce to the market of a main town located near his village. The produce that he sells the most of is dried beans and corn. His region is famous for selling these products in large quantities, as well as other ones such as chickpeas, lentils, and peas.

loans.use: To buy corn and bean seeds for planting

loans.name: Inkeida

texts.en:
Inkeida wants to repair her animals’ stable with this loan and she is seeking lenders' help to achieve this goal. She has cows and she has been selling milk to some dairy farms located in a nearby town. “I don’t like complaining about the poverty we live in, so I would say that I am grateful for whatever God has allowed us to make,” Inkeida said smiling.

Inkeida, a mother of two children who are eight and five years old, is in her mid-thirties and is married. She and her family live in the rural northeast part of the country where winters are extremely cold and snowy most of the time. Almost every villager has animals and is involved in seasonal agricultural activities. Usually what they get from all this is food and, if weather permits and doesn’t ruin their plantations, they can sell some produce to generate an income.

Kindly note that the photo is a bit blurry due to the lack of light inside the stable; yet, Inkeida wanted to be photographed there with her animals.

loans.use: To repair her animals' stable

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand the rear part of her house.

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en: Faafetai is a 39-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu (a large root vegetable like taro), yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Faafetai has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, mist blower, shovels, rake, wheel barrow, gloves and bush knives. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Faafetai hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, mist blower, shovels, rake, wheel barrow, gloves and bush knives.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Although she received no prior formal education, Beatrice is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Elmina (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. Beatrice is married and has six children. Her husband works as a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Beatrice will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences

loans.use: to buy increased amounts of fish

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi sells fish in Elmina (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about ten years. She is married to a fisherman, and together they have five children. Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Esi will use this loan to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will help her improve her overall sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Augustina did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Augustina sells goods in her small shop in Elmina (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about eight years. She is married to a mason, and together they have three children. Augustina uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Augustina will use this loan to purchase an increased amount of goods to sell in her small store, which will help her improve her overall sales. Augustina wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ama did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ama sells raw food ingredients in Engow (near Elmina). She has been doing so for about 10 years. As a widow with seven children, Ama uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.

Ama will use this loan to purchase an increased amount of products, which will help her improve her overall sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of products, which will help her improve her overall sales

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Bernice is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling corn dough in Elmina (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. 

Bernice is married and has two children. Her husband works as a miner. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Bernice will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of corn, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Bernice plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of corn.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ama did not have access to any formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ama sells fish in Elmina (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about thirty years. As a single mother with three children, Ama uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Even though Gladys grew up in poverty, without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. 

Currently, Gladys is an entrepreneur. She sells porridge in Elmina (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began it ten years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their six children. 

Gladys has identified that there are growing demands for her product among consumers. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more ingredients to make her tasty porridge to sell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to make her tasty porridge to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Elmina (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. 

Aba is married and has five children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more items like chicken, potatoes, onions and carrots for resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 33-year-old man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 13 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport and livestock business where he offers transport services to customers and also sells livestock. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in an area favorable for business and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to boost the business. 

He will use the 70,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy more livestock, i.e., cows and goats. His business goal is to be a taxi operator within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, will earn more income. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a taxi and increase his livestock. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more cows and goats

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be God-fearing. For the past eight years, Rose has operated a beauty salon where she does hair dressing and provides hair treatments. Her business is located in a busy area with many potential customers. Rose's biggest business challenge is power outages. This will be her second loan with SMEP DTM and she successfully repaid her previous 20,000 KES loan. 

Rose is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy hair chemicals and products. She will use the anticipated profits from her loan to buy the latest salon equipment and products. Her business goal is to operate a major salon that will cater to the growing population within five years. Rose hopes that, in the future, she will be able to operate more than two salons and open a training center.

loans.use: buy hair chemicals and products

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 27-year-old woman who describes herself as youthful and innovative. For the past five years, she has operated a plumbing products business where she sells sinks, water closets, pipes, and other items. Regina's business is located in a busy and accessible area with many potential customers. Her primary customers are contractors who build houses. Regina's biggest business challenges are high transportation charges and breakage of products. 

Regina is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more sinks, water closets, pipes, and other items to sell. Her business goal is to open other retail shops within five years. Regina hopes that, in the future, she will be able to purchase a mini-lorry to help her transport products from her supplier and deliver client purchases.

loans.use: to buy more sinks, water closets, pipes, and other items to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with one child. She describes herself as determined. For the past four years, Nancy has operated a grocery store where she sells cabbages, kales, carrots and other items. Her business is located in a favorable area and her primary customers are of all types. Nancy's biggest business challenge is inadequate funds. 

Nancy is requesting a 15,000 KES loan to add stock of cabbages, kales, carrots, and milk. Her business goal is to be well established within five years. Nancy hopes that, in the future, she will live well and generate a lot of income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages, kales, carrots, and milk

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Maame is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Elmina (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Maame is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Maame wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Maame plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Hannah is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling palm kernel oil in Engow (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. 

Hannah is married and has three children. Her husband works as a welder. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Hannah wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of palm kernel oil. In the long term, Hannah plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ama did not have access to any formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ama sells rice in Elmina (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about two years. She is married to a carpenter, and together they have two children. 

Ama uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of rice, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of rice

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Even though Ekua grew up in poverty, without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. 

Currently, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She sells fish in Elmina (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 15 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their five children. 

Ekua has identified that there are growing demands for her product among consumers. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish to sell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy increased amounts of fish to sell.

loans.name: Kobina

texts.en:
Even though Kobina grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped him from fulfilling his dream of achieving a better life for him and his family. Currently, Kobina is an entrepreneur who sells charcoal in Engow, near Elmina. His business has grown substantially since he began two years ago. Kobina uses the income from his business to help his wife raise their five children. He has identified that there is growing customer demand for his product, but he is unable to meet this demand due to his limited inventory capacity. 

Kobina is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. With the profits from his expanded business, he wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all his children will be given the opportunity to further distance themselves from poverty.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: After graduating high school, Francis decided to sell safe drinking water in Elmina (near Cape Coast). With over 10 years worth of experience, he is currently looking to expand his enterprise further. Unfortunately, he is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help him purchase more drinking water for resale. He aims at using the profits from his business to help support his wife (who is a teacher) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their eight children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more drinking water for resale

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Hannah is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling sandals and baby diapers in Engow (near Elmina). She has been involved in these enterprises for three years. 

Hannah is married and has five children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Hannah wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of sandals and baby diapers. 

In the long term, Hannah plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of sandals and baby diapers.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: Don Javier, junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa procrearon tres hijos que van a la escuela y dependen económicamente de él, labora para la Municipalidad como conductor de camiones pesados. Se ve en la necesidad de solicitar financiamiento porque requiere comprar materiales de construcción para repellar 20 metros de pared lo que se encuentra en mal estado y con el invierno se pondrá peor, antes que se le termine de destruir esta parte de su casa desea mejorarla, Para contar con un lugar seguro y con buenas condiciones para vivir con la familia.
texts.en: Don Javier and his wife, who is a housewife, have three children that go to school and financially depend on him. He works for the municipality as a truck driver but needs to request a loan to buy construction materials. He needs to repair 20 meters of wall that are damaged and will likely get worse during the winter. He would like to make improvements before it's too late and to count on a safe and well-conditioned house for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand, and to pay wages.

loans.name: Joash

texts.en: Joash lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a public transportation vehicle, and this has been his business for the last nine years. He found out about Milango through friend and decided to join so that he could access credit. He now seeks a loan to help him buy a car wash machine. He has employed three people who help him run the business. He wants to venture into real estate in the next five years. The major challenges of his business are careless drivers and accidents. He recommends to lenders with skills that people without experience need mentorship in terms of doing business, and this will greatly improve how they do business.

loans.use: to buy a car wash machine.

loans.name: Ssauda

texts.en: Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Ssauda is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling yams in Engow (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for one year. Ssauda is single without any children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her support herself and her extended family. Ssauda wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of yams. In the long term, Ssauda plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to buy an increased amount of yams

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is involved in selling second-hand clothing in Engow (near Elmina). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a trader) with the upkeep of their home. She has been involved in selling second-hand clothing for ten years now. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts and varieties of clothing, thus helping her to sell more, due to increased inventory capacity. 

She aspires to use her profits to both better market her second-hand clothing enterprise and to increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to buy additional second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi sells fish in Elmina, near Cape Coast, and has been doing so for about 20 years. She is married to a fisherman and together they have six children. Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Esi is reqesting a loan to purchase an increased amount of fish to aid her to improve her overall sales. She plans to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Collins is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling second-hand clothing in Engow, near Elmina, and has been running his business for eight years. Collins is married with four children and his wife works as a trader. The proceeds from his business normally go toward helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Collins is requesting a loan to purchase increased amounts of second-hand clothing to improve his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to further diversify his products to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Susie is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling goods out of her small store in Elmina, near Cape Coast, and has been running her store for ten years. Susie is married with four children and her husband works as a taxi driver. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Susie is requesting a loan to increase her current inventory levels to improve her overall sales. In the long term, she plans to reinvest her future profits into her business to help expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is single and has three children. Even though he did not receive any formal education, Peter is a successful businessman. He sells soft drinks in Elmina, near Cape Coast. He has been actively involved in this business for about 10 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Peter uses his income to provide for the entire family. Peter will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks, thus, aiding him to improve his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, Peter plans to further diversify the type of products that he sells, hence, adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en: Although he has received no prior formal education, Kwame is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling fish in Elmina (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. Kwame is married and has five children. His wife works as a petty trader. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Kwame wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Kwame plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell greater quantities of fish

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Kofi is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling charcoal in Engow (near Elmina). He has been involved in this enterprise for one year. Kofi is married and has three children. His wife works as a petty trader. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Kofi will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of charcoal, thus aiding him to improve his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kofi plans to further diversify the type of products that he sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of charcoal

loans.name: Ama

Ama is single and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman. She sells clothes in Engow (near Elmina). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of clothes, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es: Javier, es casado su esposa labora como costurera y estudia, el continua  trabajando en la municipalidad con sus ingresos se ayuda para la manutención de sus dos hijos que estan pequeños. Javier con el crédito anterior logro cambiar el techo de su vivienda, lo que significa un gran avance en su hogar, ahora solicita un nuevo financiamiento con el propósito de comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un porche y así contar con mejores condiciones de espacio para que los niños jueguen.
texts.en:
Javier is a married man who continues to work for the municipality and financially supports his two young children. His wife works as a dressmaker and also studies. 

Thanks to his previous loan, he was able to change his house ceiling, which represented a big improvement. He's now requesting a new loan to buy construction materials. He plans to build a porch so that he can provide his children with more and better space to play.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron and blocks, among others.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Mary is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Narkwa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Mary is married and her husband works as a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses. Mary wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries. In the long term, Mary plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sandals for resale

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Julio, es padre de 3 hijos que dependen de él, trabaja para la Municipalidad en el área de bodega, su esposa es ama de casa y actualmente está estudiando en la universidad para salir adelante. El mayor propósito de Julio es contar con una vivienda digna y darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, por lo que solicita este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para realizar anexo en la cocina de su casa y mejorar un cuarto para sus hijos.
texts.en: Julio has 3 children who financially depend on him. He works for the Municipality in the winery area, and his wife is a housewife and also studies at the university. Julio's main goal is to have a decent home and to provide his family with better life conditions, which is why he's requesting a loan. He plans to buy construction materials to build an annex to the kitchen and to make improvements to one of the rooms for his children.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, sand and blocks.

loans.name: Alexis Fernando

texts.es: El joven Alexis Fernando, es casado se desempeña como técnico de catastro desde hace 4 años, está muy agradecido por los financiamientos ya que con sus créditos anteriores ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Solicita su 3er crédito para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcción para poder arreglar la cocina de su casa, siendo su mayor sueño en la vida mejorar su vivienda por completo y tener estabilidad laboral para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Alexis Fernando is a young married man who has worked as a technician of the land registry for 4 years. He's grateful to Kiva for his previous loans because these have helped him to improve his family's quality of life. He's now requesting his third loan to buy construction materials to improve the kitchen. His biggest dream in life is to improve his house overall and to have job stability to support his family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, sand, iron and blocks.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ama did not have access to any form of formal education. Yet, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Ama prepares and sells ‘Wakye’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice, and colored leaves) in her village of Engow (near Elmina). She has been doing so for about two years. 

Ama is married to a farmer and, together, they have one child. Ama uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of rice and beans, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Wakye’ sales. 

Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to buy increased amounts of rice and beans.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single mother and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Florence is a successful businesswoman. She sells fried fish in Narkwa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 25 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Florence uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Florence will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Comfort did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Comfort sells cassava and tomatoes in Narkwa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 5 years. As a single mother with four children, Comfort uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Comfort will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of cassava and tomatoes, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Comfort wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of cassava and tomatoes, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

Amamatu wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

 Alberta has identified that there is growing demand among consumers’ for her products. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alberta wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

Araba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi sells smoked fish in Narkwa (near Cape Coast).  She has been doing so for about 20 years. She is married to a fisherman, and together they have three children. Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Esi will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.name: Rabeca

texts.pt:
Rabeca de 25 anos, é fiel de armazém numa empresa agrícola e trabalha das 6.30 as 15.00hrs. É mãe solteira de 1 filho com 2 anos de idade e vive na casa de sua mãe, tendo na sua responsabilidade a mãe e 3 irmãos.
Com o valor do crédito quer comprar cimento, chapas de zinco, e barrotes para dar continuidade à construção de sua casa.
O seu desejo é terminar a construção de sua casa e comprar mobília.
Diz que irá pedir mais créditos para realizar seus planos e para isso compromete se a pagar pontualmente.
texts.en:
Rabeca is 25 years old and works in a warehouse for a large farming company from 06:30 to 15:00. She's a single mother to one 2 year old son and lives in her mother's house. She is also responsible for her mother and 3 siblings.

With the value of the loan she wants to buy cement, zinc plates and beams to continue building her house.

Her wish is to finish building her home and to buy furniture for it.

Rabeca says she will ask for further loans to make this happen and to this end she commits to paying her loan off on time.

loans.use: buy cement, zinc plates and beams to continue building her house.

loans.name: Mulangani Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bikuba  est trésorière du groupe d’affaire  « Mulangani », jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’administration publique. La cliente est vendeuse des braises. Elle est propriétaire d’un entrepôt de braises. Elle commença ses affaires  avec  le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a environ 4 ans, elle fait ce petit commerce. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 25 sacs de braises. L’insécurité dans les sites d’approvisionnement, les taxes de service de l'environnement sont des grands défis pour le développement de son entreprise. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, acheter une parcelle et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs. Il sied de signaler qu'une client porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Hekima client Bikuba  is the treasurer of the business group called «Mulangani» and a young entrepreneur with a lot of experience. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of two children who both go to school. Her husband is a civil servant. The borrower sells charcoal. She owns a charcoal depot. She began her business with a loan from MFI Hekima and has been working at it for about four years. 

This new loan will be used to buy 25 sacks of charcoal. The lack of public security in the places the charcoal comes from and the taxes levied by the environmental department are the big challenges to the development of her business. She is hoping to grow her working capital, buy a plot of land, and feed her children correctly. To finish up, she thanks Hekima sincerely for their support in terms of microloans to small entrepreneurs. Please note that one client is holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy 25 sacks of charcoal

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nereo

texts.es: Nereo, es una persona responsable que se desempeña como maestro de obra en la municipalidad de Juigalpa, es soltero tiene 3 hijos a quienes  ayuda económicamente, ha solicitado en dos ocasiones créditos para componer su vivienda, con el préstamo anterior realizo una mejora en casa de su mama. Ahora solicita este tercer financiamiento para la construcción de un anexo en su propiedad, para garantizarles un hogar seguro a sus hijos que cada día van creciendo, por lo que le es necesaria esta ampliación.
texts.en:
Nereo is a responsible person that acts as a foreman in the municipality of Juigalpa.  He is single and has 3 children who he supports economically.  He has requested loans on two occasions to build his home.  With the previous loan he carried out a home improvement project in his mother's home.  

He is requesting his third credit to build an annex on his property to guarantee a safe and secure place for his children as they grow.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron and blocks

loans.name: Sabila

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Sabila did not have access to any formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Sabila prepares and sells rice and sugar for a living. She normally sells her rice and sugar in Engow (near Elmina). She has been doing so for about two years. 

Sabila is married and has one child. Due to the fact that her husband is unemployed, Sabila uses all her income to feed and provide for her entire family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of rice and sugar , which will aid her in improving her overall  sales. 

Sabila wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to buy increased amounts of rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his existing charcoal capacity.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana De San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE COPACABANA DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Sebastian, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Clida ella es conviviente y tiene 31 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de salchipapas, la socia vende las salchipapas que es un plato a base de papas con salchichas, la socia tiene una carreta donde vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 4:00 p.m hasta las 11:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papas y salchichas.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de hospedaje, negocio de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de servicio de taxi.


 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members are part of the communal bank Virgen de Copacabana de San Sebastián, located in the San Sebastián district, province of Cusco (Department of Cusco). 

Clida is one of its members. She's 31 years old and has 3 children. She has her own business selling "salchipapas" (a Latin American fast food dish that consists of sliced pan-fried beef sausages and French fries) and uses a cart to sell in the streets from 4pm to 11pm. She has had this business for 8 years and things have gone well. She's now requesting a loan to buy potatoes and sausages. Her dream is to have a restaurant in the future. 

The other group members work in the lodging, clothing, grocery and taxi businesses. Those that appear in separate pictures could not be present for the group picture due to work reasons. 

Clida is grateful to all that make this dream possible and commits to complying with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and sausages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase greater amounts of bowls to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm nuts to sell.

loans.name: Doris Maria

texts.es: La señora Doris, continua con su trabajo en la municipalidad desde hace varios años, es una mujer emprendedora que lucha día a día para brindarles a sus hijos la alimentación y educación, actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Informática Administrativa y espera salir adelante en la vida.                                  Solicita su 3er crédito para invertirlos en compra de materiales de construcción y así ir mejorando las condiciones de su hogar poco a poco; Su mayor sueño es mejorar su vivienda y terminar sus estudios universitarios para brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Doris continues with her work for the municipality, which she has been doing for several years.  She is an enterprising woman who struggles day to day in order to give her children food and an education.  She is studying computer science, and she hopes to get ahead in life.

She is requesting her third loan in order to buy construction materials.  This way she will be, little by little, improving her home’s condition.  Her biggest dream is to improve her home and to finish her university studies.  She wants to do this in order to give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bowls to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels of produce and other food ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cloth and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Greylen  Del Socorro

texts.es: Greylen, de 25 años de edad es casada pero no tiene hijos aun, se desempeña en el área de informática desde hace 4 años, es una joven con muchos deseos de superación personal y profesional, que trabaja a diario para poco a poco mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia.                                                                                               Solicita su 2do crédito para ser invertido en mejora de su vivienda  ubicada en el Coral, Chontales.                                                                                             Su sueño es que su familia permanezca unida y gozar de salud y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Greylen is 25 years old and she is married but doesn't have any children yet.  She has worked for the past 4 years in information technology.  She is a young person with lots of personal and professional goals.  She works hard every day so that little by little she can improve the living conditions of her family.

She is seeking her second loan so that she can invest in home improvements.  Her home is located in Coral, Chontales.

Her dream is that her family stays together, stays healthy, and stays employed.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, and bricks

loans.name: Radik

texts.en:
Radik is a teacher with 10 years of experience teaching at a local school. In order to tackle financial hardships, Radik is also engaged in agriculture. He runs a farm which includes three cows and 10 calves. He also cultivates potatoes and haricots. Farming helps him earn a stable income, so Radik works hard to make a profit and support his family of five, including his wife, his mother and two children, all pictured in the photo. 
By applying for this loan Radik wants to purchase six calves and forage for feeding them. He wants to raise the calves, fatten them and sell them at a profit. This will significantly increase Radik's income and will help ensure appropriate living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy six calves and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa is married with a little child. She lives in Kajaran village of Syuniq region and breeds cattle. She has three cows and four calves. She milks the cows, uses the milk in cheese production and sells high-quality cheese and other dairy products. Selling these products locally provides Alisa and her family with very important income. As a young family, they have a lot of daily costs and need financial stability.
By requesting this loan Alisa wants to increase the number of livestock she keeps. With the loan's help she will purchase two cows and a calf. 
The loan is important for Alisa and her family to expand the farming business and ensure a better and prosperous future for their little child.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and a calf

loans.name: Heriqnaz

texts.en:
Heriqnaz lives with her son in Vosketap village in the Ararat region. She earns her living by selling agricultural products in the local markets. Heriqnaz owns an orchard where different types of trees are grown (peach, apricot, plum, nut, apple, and pear). Heriqnaz has been involved in agriculture for 10 years. She became the only breadwinner in her family after her husband died and since then has worked twice as hard to provide appropriate living conditions for her son.

Heriqnaz decided to apply for this loan to purchase tomato seeds and fertilizer, which a revery important for successful cultivation of the land. The loan is very important for Heriqnaz to enlarge her farming business and increase income. She hopes that Kiva lenders will give her an opportunity to enrich both her farm and her family's income.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 49-year-old woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 18 years to 25 years. She describes herself as being aggressive. 

She operates a farm where she grows maize to sell. She has been involved in this business for 20 years and employs three staff members. Her business is located in a suitable area and her primary customers are companies and retailers. She describes her biggest business challenges to be inadequate funds and poor infrastructure. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more maize for resale. Her business goal is to buy two or three pickups for her business and also to open more stores within five years.

loans.use: to buy more maize for resale.

loans.name: Zaven

texts.en:
Zaven has a small and beautiful farm which he takes care of with great pleasure and enthusiasm. He keeps 20 sheep, 10 chickens, cows and 2 colonies of bees and owns a plot of land where different types of trees are grown (apricot, peach, nut, apple, and pear).

Zaven's wife helps him with farming activities. They have 5-year-old daughter and work hard to cover all her needs. The couple lives in a small village in the Vayots Dzor region. 

Zaven is asking a loan in order to increase the number of his livestock. He plans to purchase 21 sheep. The loan is very important for Zaven and his wife to enlarge their farm and make it more profitable.

Zaven hopes that Kiva lenders will support him to develop his farm, gather more income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for 21 sheep.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Adjoa did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Adjoa sells groceries in Effutuakwa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. As a single mother with two children, Adjoa uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Adjoa will use the loan to buy more groceries, which will help her improve her sales. Adjoa wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, which will help her improve her sales.

loans.name: Jusmara Alejandrina

texts.es: La joven Jusmara, de 22 años de edad habita en el Coral, Chontales, es soltera no tiene hijos aun, labora en la municipalidad del pueblo,                                                               esta es su primera experiencia de crédito, que solicita a Afodenic y Kiva para invertirlo en mejoras de su vivienda comprando materiales de construcción, de esta manera garantizar un hogar acogedor junto a su familia, quien espera ser bendecidos por Dios sobre todas las cosas.
texts.en:
Jusmara, age 22, lives in Coral, Chontales.  She is single, and she does not yet have any children.  She works for the village municipality.

This is her first loan experience.  She is requesting a loan from AFODENIC and Kiva in order to improve her home’s condition.  She will use the loan to buy construction materials.  This way she will secure a cozy home for her and her family.  Above all, she wishes for her family to be blessed by God.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: After graduating from junior high school, James decided to set up his own phone business in Narkwa (near Cape Coast). With over two years of experience, he is currently looking to expand his enterprise further. Unfortunately, he is held back by a shortage of funds. This loan will be used to help him buy more phones for resale. He aims to use the profits from his business to help his wife (who is a trader) with the upkeep of their house, while ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to buy more phones for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help him buy more tools and hair products for his barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of plastic containers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar and oil make more doughnuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his current livestock levels

loans.name: Griselda Antonia

texts.es: Una jovencita de 29 años de edad, es Griselda soltera sin hijos, independiente, trabaja en la Alcaldía municipal del Coral, Chontales  desde hace cuatro años, intenta salir adelante junto a su familia, y tener mejores condiciones en su hogar, para que haya armonía y tranquilidad. Es por eso que solicita su 1er crédito para construir una habitación en su casa y contar con mayor espacio, poco a poco ir arreglando otros putos de su hogar que requieren de reparación, los cuales no puede mejorar por sus pocos ingresos económicos, pero con el apoyo de crédito lograra empezar esta primera obra.
texts.en:
At a young 29 years of age, Griselda is single and doesn't have children.  She is independent and has worked in the mayor's office in Coral, Chontales for the past 4 years.  She works to help her family get ahead and to provide better conditions in their home, so that they can enjoy harmony and tranquility.  

For this reason, she is seeking her first loan so that she can build a room in her home for more space.  Little by little she wants to improve other aspects of her home that need repair, but she cannot make the improvements with her small income.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to begin doing this home-improvement work.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, and flagstones.

loans.name: Wendy Angelica

texts.es: Wendy, de 38 años habitante del barrio villa Venezuela una zona donde sus habitantes son de muy escasos recursos económicos, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, ellos al igual que su esposo tuvieron que emigrar fuera del país en busca de una vida mejor, hoy en día Wendy trabaja sola para poder salir adelante en la vida con su negocio de venta de calzado y trastes usados y nuevos. El crédito que solicita es para mejorar las condiciones de su casa, por motivo de que el agua se le mete en estas épocas de lluvia, por eso le urge comprar ventanas para ponerlos en los cuartos, los cuales están descubiertos.
texts.en: Wendy, 38, lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood a zone whose residents are of very low economic resources.  Her children are all now independent adults.  They and her husband had to emigrate abroad seeking better lives and Wendy works alone to be able to get ahead in life with her business selling shoes and new and used kitchenware.  The loan she’s asking for is to make some improvements to her house because water gets in during the rainy season.  Because of this she wants to buy windows to install in the rooms which are currently uncovered.

loans.use: to buy windows to install.

loans.name: Arche De Noé Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwavita  est leader du groupe d’affaire  « Arche de Noé», doyenne, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 2 ont déjà leurs familles respectives et 4 étudient encore. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école publique. La cliente est vendeuse de friperie au marché centrale et parfois à son domicile. En plus, elle est propriétaire d’une boutique de divers. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 15 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 ballons de friperie. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: The client Mwavita is the leader of the business group "Arche de Noé." She is a doyenne, experienced entrepreneur, 51 years old, married and mother to 6 children of whom 2 already have their respective families and 4 still study. Her spouse is a teacher in a public school. The client is a seller of used clothing at the central market and sometimes from home. In addition, she owns a boutique of a variety of items. She started her businesses with her own funds received from her husband, about 15 years ago. This new loan will be used to buy 2 bundles of used clothing. Thus, she hopes to grow her business, school and feed her children. Finally, she deeply thanks Hekima for its microloan support to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 2 bundles of used clothing.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is the owner of a drug store located in Narkwa (near Cape Coast). His earnings are generally used to help his wife (who is a teacher) support their six children. He has been involved in selling medicine for 12 years. He plans to use his loan to buy more inventory, which will help him sell more. He aspires to use his profits to better market his enterprise and to increase his existing working capital. He hopes that this strategy will allow him to expand his customer base.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines for his drug store, thus helping him to increase sales.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Even though Grace grew up in poverty and without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Grace is an entrepreneur. She sells provisions in Narkwa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began one year ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their three children. Grace has identified growing demand among consumers for her products. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. She aims to use her loan to buy more provisions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more hair products, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Wilberto Antonio

texts.es: Don Wilberto, siempre se desempeña en la unidad ambiental de la municipalidad del Coral, un pueblo cercano de la Ciudad de Juigalpa, no tiene hijos aun es soltero, ayuda a su familia en los gastos del hogar y paga sus créditos poco a poco. Solicita su 3er Préstamo para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcción y una vez terminando de pagarlo espera en Dios obtener otro financiamiento para empezar la mejora de su vivienda ya que no puede realizar de una sola vez este gasto por sus limitaciones económica, su sueño es gozar de salud y que a su familia no le falte lo básico en el hogar y seguir estudiando para ser un buen profesional.
texts.en: Wilberto always works in the town of Coral, near the City of Juigalpa.  He is single and has no children, helps his family with the household expenses, and repays his loans a little at a time.  He is asking for a third loan so he can buy building materials.  Once he repays this one he hopes, with God’s help, to get another loan so he can make improvements to his home, as he is unable to do them now due to financial limitations.  His dreams are to enjoy good health and for his family not to be in need of basic items and that he can continue to study so me can become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Seydi Jahzeel

texts.es: Seydi , una joven de 23 años de edad, casada no tienen hijos aun, junto a su esposo se dedican a trabajar en un tramo que alquila en donde vende ropa usada, con ánimos de superarse también estudia una carrera de licenciatura en enfermería, ha pasado muchas dificultades junto a su esposo  ya que en ocasiones no tienen capital de trabajo para abastecer su negocio el cual es su único ingreso, este medio ha sido una alternativa bastante favorable para una parte de la población en Nicaragua que se dedica al negocio de ropa usada. Es por eso que Seydi solicita este primer crédito para invertir comprando pacas de ropa para mejorar sus ingresos y así culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Seydi, age 23, is married, but does not have any children yet.  She and her husband work at a vending station that she rents, where she sells used clothes.  With thoughts of improving herself, she is also studying for a career in nursing.

She has experienced a lot of difficulties together with her husband.  Sometimes they do not have work capital to stock their business, which is her only source of income.  This trade has been a pretty favorable alternative for a part of Nicaragua’s population who devote themselves to the business of used clothing.

That is why Seydi is requesting her first loan.  She will buy bundles of clothes in order to improve her income.  This way she will complete her studies.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Francis Yahaira

texts.es: La señora Francis trabajadora lucha dia a dia  para poder mejorar sus condiciones de Vida, habita en el km 10 1/2 carretera a Masaya, junto a su esposa sueñan con terminar de construir su casa, ella lavora para una empresa privada al igual su esposo, su mayor dificultad es que se les hace imposible recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para compra los materiales, con este credito que se le ha otorgado compra los materiales necesarios como: Bloques, cemento, Arena, Hierro, Piedrin, asi completara la parte trasera de su casa, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Francis struggles daily to improve her living conditions.  She lives at the 10-1/2 kilometer mark along the Masaya highway.  She and her husband dream with finishing building their house.  She and her husband both work for a private firm.  Her greatest difficulty is the impossibility of gathering all the money they need for building supplies at one time.  With this loan that’s been granted them she will buy the necessary supplies like blocks, cement, sand, iron and gravel and be able to finish the rear section of her house.  She is grateful for the support Afodenic and Kiva funds have provided her.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Joyce is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling “kenkey” (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her kenkey in Hohoe. She has been involved in preparing and selling kenkey for 10 years. Joyce is married and has five children. Her husband works as an electrician. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Joyce wants to use her loan to buy more maize (corn), thus increasing her current inventory levels. This will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty kenkey. In the long term, Joyce plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more maize (corn), thus increasing the inventory levels of her business preparing and selling “kenkey” (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves).

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: Doña María, una señora trabajadora que a como pudo logro independizar a todos sus hijos junto a su esposo quien siempre le apoya en todo, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de prendas de plata que con las ventas se ayuda para pagar los gastos principales del hogar siendo su único medio de ingreso. En vista de carecer de productos que ofrecer, solicita nuevamente un 11vo crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su pequeño negocio que la ha mantenido hasta el momento, gracias a los financiamientos de Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en: María is a hardworking lady who was able to make her children independent in whatever way possible with her husband’s help; he always supports her in everything.  She continues selling silver items and with her sales is able to cover her main household expenses; this is her only source of income.  Because she lacks items to offer, she’s once again asking for a loan, her 11th, to continue investing in the small business she’s kept running to date thanks to loans from Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy silver items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tools for milling.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Don Carlos, es un señor con 3 hijos de los cuales uno va a la universidad y dos están en la escuela secundaria, Carlos prácticamente es padre soltero ya que su esposa emigro a otro país en busca de una vida mejor, mientras el continua su labor como cadete de taxi, por el cual desde mucho tiempo tiene la ilusión de tener su propio vehículo de trabajo pero no ha podido por lo que tiene que alquilar taxi para poder trabajar y ganarse la vida a diario de esta manera apoya a sus hijos con los estudios. El crédito que solicita es para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer una división de cuartos y garantizar la comodidad de sus hijos.
texts.en: Carlos is a man with three children one of which is attending university and two are in secondary school. He’s practically a single father since his wife emigrated to another country seeking a better life while he continues working as a taxi driver.  For a long time he’s dreamed with having his own work vehicle but has been unable to do so; he must lease a taxi in order to work and earn a living daily to support his children’s schooling.  The loan he’s requesting is to buy building materials and supplies to build room divisions to insure his children’s comfort.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 36 years old, married and has three children. She describes herself as an aggressive businesswoman. She operates a cereals store where she sells maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her store is located in an area suited for business and her primary customers are grinding mill owners and small cereal store owners. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to add to her stock of maize. Her business goal is to be stable and successful within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add to her stock of maize

loans.name: Araqsya

texts.en: Araqsya is from the Ahotavan village in the Sisian region. Local people here are mostly involved in cattle breeding, and some limited land cultivation. Araqsya lives with her husband and 13-year-old daughter. She runs a farm that includes 15 goats, 2 cows, 5 calves and 30 chickens. Araqsya also owns a plot of land where she cultivates barley and grows different types of trees (peach, apricot, nut, apple and pear). Farming business is very important for Araqsya to earn income and cover the family's basic costs. She has applied for this loan because wants to enlarge her farm. By purchasing 2 calves, 10 goats and fuel (to transport her harvest to the market), Araqsya will be able to increase her monthly income and improve her living conditions. She awaits your support!

loans.use: to buy 2 calves, 10 goats and fuel to transport her harvest to the market.

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en:
Over 12 years of hard work, Goharik has owned a beautiful farm which is in Artashat town of the Arararat region. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates haricot, tomatoes, potatoes, and grows apricot and cherry trees. 

Goharik has a nice family whose members help each other on the farm since they know that working together ensures that they will earn a higher income. Gohar lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and grandchild. 

Now, Gohar has requested this loan of USD 2,000 in order to purchase fertilizer and seeds and to start cultivation of more types of fruits and vegetables. The loan is very important to help Goharik to enlarge her farm and to gather more income. 

She hopes very much that Kiva will support her and help her to make the family's living conditions better.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single woman. She has two children, ages 3 and 13 years old. She describes herself to be outgoing . She operates a jewelry and cosmetics business in which she sells jewels and cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a promising area. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more jewels for resale. Her business goal is to have two more chain stores within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be a well-known seller of jewelry. She will use the anticipated profits to open two more chain stores.

loans.use: to buy more jewels for resale

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a grocery store in which she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a potential area and her primary customers are local residents. Her biggest business challenge is that most of the products she sells are perishable. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy vegetables for resale, such as carrots, potatoes, passion fruit, etc. Her business goal is to be a supplier to major hotels within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will achieve financial success. This is her first loan loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale, such as carrots, potatoes, passion fruit, etc.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is the only breadwinner of his family. He breeds cattle and cultivates greens for feeding animals. Arsen is married and lives with his wife in the small village Tandzaver, which is in the Syuniq region. He learned how to breed cattle when he was a little boy and is now a very skilled farmer. Arsen’s wife helps him very much. She milks cows and makes cheese and other dairy products. 

Arsen is also a teacher with many years of experience teaching at the local school. As the teacher's salary is hardly enough for this young family, agriculture is the only source of income that helps them to tackle financial difficulties.

Arsen is requesting this loan of 1,500 USD to purchase a cow and a calf and enlarge his livestock. He is very motivated about developing his farm and improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and a calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: add to her stock of rice, maize flour, wheat flour and other food stuffs she cooks in the hotel

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Changamwe, in the suburbs of Mombasa, Kenya. 

For the last five years, Esther has been running a mobile money transfer shop. She is a single mother of one. 

Esther knew Milango Financial Services through friends and now she seeks a loan to add float to her business. This will increase the transactions she can do in a day. She also sells charcoal and firewood and she earns extra income from that. 

Her ambition in the next five years is to grow the business and employ more people. The challenge she has been facing is insufficient float in her account to do transactions. The loan will improve her living standards and she will be able to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to add float to her mobile money transfer shop.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.fr: La cliente Rose  est conseillère du groupe d’affaire  « Shalom », doyenne, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 11 enfants dont certains ont déjà leurs familles respectives. Son conjoint est un tailleur (couturier). La cliente est vendeuse des poissons. Elle installe ses produits au long de la rue. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari.
