texts.es: Benita reside en el sector del Fortín que pertenece a la ciudad de Guayaquil – Ecuador, actualmente vende ropa, zapatos y otros artículos que le soliciten los clientes, este negocio lo emprendió gracias a la motivación de una vecina ya que Benita tenia antes un pequeño restaurante, la venta de sus productos la realiza fuera de la ciudad para lo cual tiene que realizar viajes los fines de semana con el objetivo de visitar diferentes pueblos, su sueño a mediano plazo es adquirir una camioneta para poder viajar a mas ciudades y llevar mas mercadería, con el préstamo actual comprara mas mercadería.
texts.en: Benita lives in Guayaquil, Ecuador’s El Fortín sector.  She currently sells clothes, shoes and other items customers request.  She started this business thanks to encouragement from a neighbor since Benita used to have a small restaurant.  She sells her products outside the city which means she has to make trips on weekends to visit various towns. Her dream for the medium run is to acquire a pick-up truck to be able to visit more cities and take her merchandise.  She will use the current loan to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals.

loans.name: Olga Liliana

texts.es: Olga reside en la ciudad de Quevedo – Ecuador, es la hija menor de una numerosa familia, desde muy corta edad tenia muchos deseos de superación, con mucha motivación y esfuerzo emprendió la venta de ropa y productos de belleza, el mismo que lo atiende de lunes a sábado, los días domingos de dedica asiste a un centro de estudios, el préstamo lo destinara a la compra de ropa, productos de belleza y una vitrina, sus sueño es tener un negocio en su domicilio.
texts.en: Olga lives in the city of Quevedo, Ecuador.  She’s the youngest daughter in a very large family and since she was little she’s had a strong drive for self-improvement.  With much motivation and effort she started to sell clothes and beauty products Monday to Saturday.  On Sundays she attends school.  She will use the loan to buy clothes, beauty products and a display case.  Her dream is to have a home-based business.

loans.use: to buy a display case, clothes and beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, pork, junket and cheese.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario wants to prove that being a farmer does not mean that you cannot succeed. He is doing his best to become one of the successful farmers in their village. Through his profit from farming, he is able to support the education of his children.  

Mario is a rice grower. He admits that he has difficulty in financing his farming needs since his priority is the education of his children. Because of this, Mario is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides and to pay labor costs for land preparation. He is positive that having this capital will make his business grow and be profitable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 21 years old and he is a student of Yerevan European Academy, the faculty of Economics and Management, with the specialty of International Economic Relations (paid division). 

Martin lives in the village of Tsovagyugh, which is in Gegharkunik region. He lives with his mother and school-age sister. Martin’s father is in the Russian Federation, in a job abroad, the income of which is a little help with the family's numerous needs. 

They also have some income from farming and agriculture. They have three cows, one bull, two calves, five sheep, and three lambs. On a small plot of land, Martin’s mother cultivates cucumbers, tomatoes, strawberries, currants, and blackberries for the family's use. 

It is obvious that it is very hard for Martin’s family to pay for his education. Martin asks a loan of AMD 225,000 (Armenian drams) to pay his tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 33, is from Ndunyu Njeru, in Kenya. He is married to Joyce, and they have one child. 

John has a carpentry business, which he has operated for the past four years. His business generates a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings.
 
John has applied for his second loan from the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology. This loan will enable him to buy timber after paying back his previous loan.

John's anticipated profit will be used to purchase materials for his business. He hopes to own the best workshop in his area in the near future.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Mayra Jacqueline

texts.es: Mayra reside en la ciudad de Quevedo – Ecuador, desde temprana edad le gustaba todo lo relacionado a la belleza y el arte culinario, decide iniciar su propio local de venta de comida y un salón de belleza en sociedad con su hermana, con el préstamo desea comprar implementos para el salón de belleza y su sueño es que su negocio sea reconocido en la ciudad y posteriormente brindar servicios de SPA.
texts.en: Mayra lives in the city of Quevedo, Ecuador.  From a very young age she's liked everything related to beauty and to culinary arts.  She decided to open a business selling food and in partnership with her sister has a beauty salon.  She wants to use the loan to buy supplies for the beauty salon and her dream is that the business becomes well-known in the city and later on to provide spa services.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Betzy Cecilia

texts.es: Betzy reside en el sector del Fortín de la ciudad de Guayaquil – Ecuador, inicio su negocio hace tres años, desde temprana edad le gustaba todo lo relacionado a la costura y el diseño de ropa, con el préstamo desea comprar telas y una maquina industrial.
texts.en: Betzy resides in Guayaquil, Ecuador’s El Fortín sector.  She started her business three years ago.  From a very young age she’s liked everything related to sewing and clothing design.  She wants to use the loan to buy fabric and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.use: to by an industrial sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is 33 years old. She lives in Dzirula village, Zestaponi district with her parents. Maka requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Maka’s father is an artisan. He is working on house renovations and constructions from private orders to earn a small income for the family. This is the only source of income for them.

Maka requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Maka will start trading with clothes. She will purchase clothes at wholesale prices from the big market and start reselling them among her villagers with a price markup. She will try to work as hard as she can to earn a good profit. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the same business, in order to expand her trading, and another part will be used for the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To start trading with clothes.

loans.name: Abdel Halim

texts.en:
Abdel Halim, 56, is married and the father of six children. He owns a small shop in his village, where he sells European clothes and shoes. His wife helps him run the store. 

One of his children is still enrolled in public school to receive the education his parents did not have the opportunity to acquire; Abdel Halim's highest degree is from intermediate school. 

Abdel Halim contacted Al Majmoua because he needs to enhance and expand his business, which he started only two years ago. In fact, he needs the loan to purchase the summer collection and raise his revenue. 

As for the future, Abdel Halim hopes to further develop his business by setting up an appropriate decor that would be suitable to the merchandise he offers.

loans.use: to purchase the summer collection and raise his revenue

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María, de 39 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur de Managua, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes como empleada domestica y los fines de semana vende carne, de esta manera María intenta salir adelante con sus tres hijos quienes van a la escuela y para ella es prioridad garantizar su educación, comparte los gastos del hogar con su esposo quien trabaja como albañil. María desea empezar a construir las paredes de su casa de concreto, es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para empezar la obra, esto le permitirá un hogar seguro para sus hijos y evitara la filtración de agua cuando llueve.
texts.en:
María, who is 39 years old, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. She works from Monday to Friday as a domestic employee, and on the weekends, she sells meat. In this way, María tries to provide for her three children, who are in school; guaranteeing their education is a priority for her. She shares the household costs with her husband, who works in construction. 

María hopes to begin building the concrete walls of her house. She is requesting this loan to buy construction materials to start the project. This will allow her to have a safe home for her children and keep out the water when it rains.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar, and blocks.

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.es: Un joven que busca como salir adelante junto a su familia es Danilo, quien es casado y tiene  un hijo a quien mantener por quien trabaja sin descanso para lograr darle sus estudios, mientras el trabaja como despachador en una ferretería su esposa se encarga de una pequeña pulpería a la que desea invertir para continuar vendiendo, siendo sus principales clientes los vecinos del barrio donde habitan.
texts.en: Danilo is a young man who fights to get ahead with his family. He's married, has one child and works very hard to provide him with studies in the future. He works as a salesman in a hardware store, while her wife runs a small grocery store, where he wants to invest. Their main clients are their neighbors.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sodas, canned products and toiletries, among others.

loans.name: Presily

texts.en:
Presily earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. She lives with her husband and five children in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock for her store, like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. With this, she will be able expand her inventory and attract more buyers to her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store, like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, age 27, runs an electronics shop in Kiambu to earn a living. She also offers photocopying and typing services. She earns a monthly income of 50,000 shillings from her business.

Jane and her husband John have two children. 

This will be Jane’s second loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy photocopy paper and electronic items for her store. 

In the future, she hopes to see her business prosper so that she can better provide for the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to buy photocopy paper and electronic items for her store

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is forty-nine years old and single, she has two children who are both adults.  She is a farmer in Ndumberi in the outskirts of Kiambu town and has been in this business for five years and earns an income of twenty eight thousand shillings.

This will be Jane’s second loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy piglets and renovate her cattle shed. In the future she wants to fully provide for her family, increase the milk supply and become a successful pig farmer.

loans.use: to buy piglets and renovate her cattle shed.

loans.name: Maria Gisella

texts.es:
María reside en el sector del Fortín de la ciudad de Guayaquil – Ecuador, su negocio lo inicio hace cuatro años, se dedica a la venta de productos cárnicos, esta actividad inicia  desde las 06
:00 hasta las 12:00. el préstamo será destinado para realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, su sueño a corto plazo es hacer su casa de hormigón armado y tener un local para iniciar un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
María lives in Guayaquil, Ecuador’s El Fortín sector.  She started her business four years ago selling meat products; she’s open for business from six until noon.  

The loan will be used to make some home improvements. Her short-term goal is to build her house out of reinforced concrete and to have a space in which to start a beauty salon.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Nancy Jessica

texts.es: Nancy reside en la ciudad de Portoviejo – Ecuador,  su negocio inicio hace varios años por que tenían pocos ingresos económicos en el hogar, se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa, atiende el negocio sola porque su esposo trabaja, el préstamo lo destina para la compra de ropa, zapatillas y pantalones, su sueño e terminar de construir la casa y contar con un local para que funcione un bazar.
texts.en: Nancy lives in the city of Portoviejo, Ecuador.  Her business started several years ago because they had little income at home.  She works making and selling clothes.  She tends to the business by herself because her husband works.  She will earmark the loan to buy clothes, sandals and pants.  Her dream is to finish building her house and to have a space where a clothing store can operate.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sandals and pants.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is a hardworking Iraqi youth client who is 26 years old, married and a father of a single child. Yaser works to provide the family income while his wife takes care of their child.

Yaser owns a small workplace where he specializes in printing and photocopying documents. In his shop, Yaser also sells mobile phones and recharging cards. He established his business in 2009 and since then, this business has been the source of living for his family. Yaser gained good experience in the neighborhood and is well known with an excellent reputation, thanks to his providing services.

Yaser is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy a new photocopying machine. He believes that this loan will help him in the growth of his business and will increase his revenues. It will also grant him the ability to give the best living standards to his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy a new photocopying machine.

loans.name: Ferzana

texts.en:
Ferzana is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been operating a business of selling bangles for one year in order to contribute to her family's income. Her husband has a job in a factory but makes an insufficient amount of income to fulfill the demands of his family. 

Ferzana offers various types of bangles in different colors and sizes to the people of her community. She also sells the sets of bangles in the market at reasonable rates. For the further improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. In this way she would be able to purchase more variety of bangles in various sizes, colors and designs. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of bangles in various sizes, colors and designs.

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and a mother of four. Three of her children attend school. She has been frying fish and selling them to her customers for the last five years. This 37 year old has a vision of increasing her savings. 

She learned of Milango through friends at a time when she needed credit to enhance her business. She has one employee who helps her in running the business. She now seeks a loan to buy 10kgs of fish. The extra income that is raised from the loan will be used to pay her children's school fees and to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy 10kgs of fish.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara, age 25, is a maize farmer. She grows maize on a half hectare of agricultural land, then harvests and sells the produce locally. She lives in the small village of Lagodekhi District with her two daughters and grandmother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Their income barely provides enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tamara would like to start up a family dairy farm business. She has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up purposes, but without success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

She has now requested a loan from Credo to start up the family business. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products because they are perceived as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. 

With the received credit, Tamara will purchase a milking cow. Once the milking cow is purchased, Tamara will produce dairy products to offer for sale. In an effort to earn additional income, she will also purchase clothing items to offer for sale. These investments will increase the income of her family. 

Tamara's new business initiatives, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow, as well as clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 34 years old. She lives in Chabinaani village, Akhmeta district with her parents and 13 year old son. Khatuna has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The family owns a vineyard. With the harvested grapes they produce wine and sell it at the local markets to earn a small monthly income. Their additional income is Khatuna’s father’s salary. He is an artisan and works on private orders on house constructions and renovations. 

Khatuna requested a loan from Credo to start-up the family business. Khatuna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products. These poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Khatuna will start trading with clothes from Turkey. She will go there to purchase products at the wholesale price, bring it to her village and sell with the price marked-up among the villagers. Khatuna will earn a profit and reinvest it in her business to have better choice to offer to her clients. She will earn an additional income for the family and will be able to provide better a life for them.

loans.use: to start trading with clothes from Turkey.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Gloria reside en la ciudad de Portoviejo – Ecuador, Por la falta de trabajo y por consejos de la familia instalo una lavandería en su domicilio, donde inicia la atención a partir del medio día, con el préstamo desea comprar una secadora y unos tanques, su sueño es tener una lavandería mas grande, que su hija estudie enel extranjero y que su esposo tenga un taller de elaboracion de maquinas para helados.
texts.en: Gloria lives in the city of Portoviejo, Ecuador.  Because of the lack of employment and on advice from the family she opened a laundry at home where she starts work at noon.  She wants to use the loan to buy a dryer and some tanks.  Her dream is to have a bigger laundry, that her daughter studies abroad and that her husband has a workshop to manufacture ice-cream making machines.

loans.use: to buy a dryer and tanks.

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en:
Kamila is a 45-year-old single woman who lives in a Palestinian camp in southern Lebanon, just like other Palestinian refugee seeking peace in Lebanon. She owns a small tailoring business and sells her products. She has been working in this field for about 15 years. 

The dire living conditions in the camp are a burden on her shoulders and her father's, whom she lives with, because owning a small business in such a place is not very profitable. She decided to contact Al Majmoua to acquire a loan to help her purchase a new sewing machine and embroidery pieces. 

As for the future, Kamila wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and embroidery pieces

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 61-year-old, married mother of five children who are all also married. She owns a small business based in her house where she cooks home-made food, and sells dresses that she makes. Her husband is a school bus driver. Their income is very low, which is why it is very important for her to enhance and expand her business. In fact, this is why she contacted Al Majmoua to acquire a loan. She will use the loan and invest in a car because it will help her transport merchandise and products throughout the city.

loans.use: to buy a car to transport merchandise and products throughout the city.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a ceiling made of cement.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: El señor Pedro O., habita en el municipio de Masaya con sus familia, el sueña con poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, desde hace muchos años atras el se dedica al cultivo de Yuca, actualmente requiere de capital para estableser dos manzanas de yuca, el terreno ya lo tiene limpio y preparado, c on este credito compra los insumos y fertilizantes necesario, ademas comprara la madera de  yuca para sembrarla, Agredece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado todos estos años.
texts.en:
Pedro O. lives in the municipality of Masaya with his family. His dream is to be able to improve their living conditions. He has earned his living cultivating cassava for many years. 

Pedro currently needs capital to establish two “manzanas” [a unit of measurement equal to 1.72 acres] of cassava. He already has the land cleared and prepared; with this loan, he will buy the necessary supplies and fertilzers. In addition, he will buy the cassava cuttings to plant. 

He is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have provided him all these years.

loans.use: to maintain his crops

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer, age 25, earns a small income as an employee in the public sector. This is the only source of income for his family. He and his wife have a young daughter and live in the city of Rafah.
 
Tamer has requested a loan from FATEN because he would like to buy a new laptop computer. This investment will allow him to read articles and news items so that he can stay educated in current developments. He will also use the laptop to communicate with his friends and family. 
  
Tamer would like eventually to open his own business project in the future by taking out another loan from FATEN.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his personal use

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es: El Sr. Marcos, padre responsable que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos y con su labor como guarda de seguridad se ayuda para los gastos de escuela de ellos , solicita el préstamo para realizar compra de materiales de construcción para realizar un anexo de porche en su casa de habitación, ya que este esta en muy malas condiciones, don Marcos agradece el apoyo de financiamiento ya que con ello podrá mejorar su nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos is a responsible father who safeguards the wellbeing of his children; his work as a security guard helps with their educational expenses. He is requesting the loan to make a purchase of construction materials in order to add a porch onto his house, since his is in very bad condition. 

Marcos is grateful for the financing support since it will enable him to improve his and his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar, and blocks.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of seven grown children. Farming is their main source of income.

Ponciana works hard to support her husband on their farm. As of now, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. 

In the future, Ponciana hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Armenio

texts.en:
Armenio owns six hectares of rice field within his locality. He has managed this kind of business for 32 years. He is a hardworking father and responsible husband. He is happily married and has been blessed with three children.

Armenio would like to seek additional capital of PHP 30,000 due to the many hectares of rice field he operates. He will use this amount to buy essential insecticides and fertilizer to keep his rice field productive. Armenio knows that this loan will have much to do with the improvement of his rice crops because he could nourish them with complete farm supplies. He just hopes and prays that lenders will grant his requested amount of loan so he could sustain his family's well-being and send his three children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to improve his rice farming business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She is a married woman and has four children.

Vilma is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda, noodles, biscuits, and snack foods. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stocks and attract more customers and buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda, noodles, biscuits, and snack foods.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 49 years old and married to Ruth. They have four children, two of whom are in school. Peter practices farming in Ndunyu Njeru and has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizer and seeds. He paid his previous loan successfully. With anticipated profits, he plans to buy more seeds and fertilizer and to pay school fees. He hopes to start large scale farming in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Derenik

texts.en:
Derenik and his family live in the village of Tsaghkunk, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Derenik is 41 years old and he lives with his father, who is retired, his wife and two school-aged children. His wife does not work and she helps Derenik around their farm. 

For some time he worked as a herdsman in their village, but now he has his own farm and a plot of land, on which he mainly cultivates grains. On his farm he keeps five cows, three calves, twenty sheep and fifteen lambs. He mentions that today it is very hard for villagers to earn their living, since the prices of the entire farm product that he manages to sell to his loyal customers and re-sellers, are very cheap, and no matter how hard they work the income is very small.

This is Derenik’s first loan, and he asks for a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams for the organization of the work of hay mowing and to buy some fodder for his animals.

loans.use: To buy some fodder for his animals and to organize the work of hay mowing.

loans.name: Rapig

texts.en:
Rapig is 43 years old. He lives in a small village of Bolnisi District with his wife and mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Rapig requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a 0.8 hectare of agricultural land, where potatoes, maize and cucumbers are grown. They sell the harvested products at local markets at a good price. In addition, his wife trades in clothing. It is hardly enough to feed the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Rapig requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Rapig will purchase milking cows. He plans to start a husbandry business. They will start producing dairy products to sell. This will increase the income of their family. With the increased income they will expand the dairy farm in the future. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase milking cows

loans.name: Annonciatha

texts.en: Annonciatha is 60 years old. She is a widow. She sells foodstuffs, and she has been in business for the past four years. She has requested the loan to buy more beans and sorghum for resale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Muchumba Self Help Group

texts.en:
Muchumba Self Help Group is a community group with 20 members representing 20 families, with an aim of combining resources for self empowerment. Since its initiation in the year 2012, the group members have saved together to buy water tanks for their families. They have been using the merry-go-round system, though, so only 10 of them have received the water tanks as they are only able to buy one tank per month. Their problem is not only water. Since most of them cannot afford to install electricity in their homes, they are forced to buy kerosene for lighting and firewood for cooking. Having partnered with Visionary Empowerment Programme, they have learned that they can benefit from a more affordable credit scheme to enable them to access quality renewable energy products.

As a result, they have all benefited from a loan to purchase a solar package for their home and an efficient cookstove. The solar package will enable them charge their mobile phones and use a small radio as well as save them from  buying  kerosene again. The efficient cookstove will save them at least 50% of the firewood they had been using with traditional cookstoves, therefore easing the burden of collecting firewood daily. The cookstove also reduces smoke emission and will be better for their health.

Since they are all farmers, proceeds from their farming businesses and the little they save by not buying kerosene will enable them pay the loan. Thanks to green energy technologies, more homes can enjoy improved lives.

John and Simon, standing 3rd from left and 2nd from right respectively, are brothers in law. John is the group chair and Simon is the coordinator, positions they earned as they pioneered the group formation. They, like the rest of the group members, wish to get empowered through renewable energy products that save them money and create a better environment for their families. Their future plan is to supply the lamps to their neighbors as a business.

loans.use: to pay for solar lamps and efficient cookstoves

loans.name: Perseverancia Group

texts.es: Perseverancia es un grupo solidario nuevo, llamado así por que sus integrantes no se dan por vencidas ante situaciones complicadas. Aurora es una mujer de 32 años, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 7 y10 años, es casada; se dedica a la venta de joyería de plata, comenzó hace 1 año y 6 meses, menciona que solo tiene clientes seleccionados y el crédito lo usará para surtir mas joyería de plata y algo de oro. A Aurora le gustaría empezar a vender accesorios de fantasía y algo de ropa nueva. El grupo Perseverancia es responsable y se conocen desde hace muchos años.
texts.en:
Perseverancia [perseverance] is a new solidarity group. The name represents the fact that the group members do not give up in the face of adversity. The members are responsible and have known each other for many years.

Aurora, one of the members, is 32 years old, married, and has three children aged five, seven, and ten. A year and a half ago she began selling silver jewelry. She states that she has select customers, and now would use this loan to offer more silver jewelry and some of gold. Aurora would also like to begin selling costume jewelry and some new clothing.

loans.use: to buy more silver and gold jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Zakieh

texts.en:
Zakieh is a 52-year-old widow and a mother of four children. She lives with her family in a marginalized Palestinian camp in southern Lebanon, just like almost all of the Palestinian refugees with limited working opportunities. 

For 15 years, Zakieh has worked as a housekeeper for a Lebanese family, to take care of her children and raise them properly. One of her children is also working. However, their combined income is in no way sufficient to provide for a family of six members. Zakieh's other children are enrolled in public school, so that they could be provided with a good education, a privilege Zakieh did not have the opportunity to acquire since she is illiterate. 

She decided to acquire a loan from Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development because she needs the money in order to help her son to continue building his new house. As for the future, she wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to help her son to continue building his new house.

loans.name: Imad Edin

texts.en:
Imad is a married man, from Gaza City. He is the father of three young sons. Imad works in a furniture workshop that he owns. This is a profitable project, but seasonal. The demand for his products increases in the summer, because wedding parties increase.

Imad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some textiles for his business. This will help him to increase his productivity and meet the demand in the local market. By applying this loan, he will increase his productivity and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy some textiles for his furniture-making business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace 2 años lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar pescado por mayor y seguir con su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client is a single mother who lives in her own house with her son. She has sold fish for some 2 years now in the streets of the different neighbohoods near her place of residence. With the earnings she obtains from her sales, she manages to cover some of her household expenses. 

The client is requesting a loan to be able to purchase fish at wholesale and continue with her business, in order to obtain better earnings and to enable her to give her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy fish at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 23 years old, who lives with his 5 brothers, his sister and his parents. Hasan and his father, along with 2 of his brothers, together provide the family's income.

Hasan has an entertainment center. In his shop, he provides the teenagers of his neighborhood with the most updated Play Station games in a very friendly and fun environment. He started practicing this business in 2011, and since then he has gained good experience in this field.

He is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to buy 6 new computers in order to expand his business and increase the variety of his provided services. Hasan believes that this loan will positively effect the improvement of his current financial condition, and will aid him in taking better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy 6 new computers.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina wishes to be a student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. She hopes to take the management program in commerce and harbor administration. Agustina wants to become an expert in the field of shipping and administration so that she can work in the port. 

She is the first child of five siblings and is from the island of Sumatra, precisely in Asahan district, North Sumatra. 

Because Agustina’s parents are just farmers whose income per month is uncertain, Agustina hopes to obtain a loan from Kiva investors. She could finish her education quickly and can ease the burden on her parents. She wants to quickly get a job in order to help her sisters. Her parents are very hopeful for Agustina, so when she finishes college later, she could help fund their schooling. 

Agustina is very grateful to Kiva investors who help finance her studies.

loans.use: to pay education fees for three years.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi, a 30-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are in school, raises and fattens pigs in the Philippines. In business for a year now, she has received three previous loans from NWTF and is requesting a new one for PHP 10000 to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

In the future, Noemi would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water pump to irrigate his vegetable crops and expand his farm

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila tiene 57 años, está casada y vive en su casa junto a su esposo. Zoila se dedica a la venta de comida rápida y platos regionales como asados de carnes y plátanos, todos los días ella se dirige al mercado de la ciudad para comprar todos los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos que vende en la vereda de su casa. Viene realizando este trabajo hace 4 años y desde que empezó ha recibido la ayuda y el apoyo constante de su hija. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede realizar en su casa y le agrada generar sus propios ingresos económicos trabajando en la cocina. Al principio le pareció difícil acostumbrarse al ritmo de trabajo pero ahora su negocio es estable, y espera más adelante poder instalar un restaurante y ahí poder atender mejor a su clientela. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su negocio. Asegura ser puntual con sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará todos los ingredientes necesarios para continuar con su negocio como papa, arroz, aceite, carnes entre otros.
texts.en:
Zoila is 57. She is married and lives in her home with her husband. She sells fast food and regional dishes such as meat and banana roasts. She goes to the market in the city every day to buy all the necessary ingredients for preparing the foods that she sells in the front part of her home. She has been doing this work for four years, and her daughter has been her constant help and support since she started. What she likes about her job is the ability to work from home, and she enjoys generating her own income working in the kitchen. In the beginning it seemed difficult to get used to the rhythm of the work, but now her business is stable. She hopes to be able to open a restaurant in the future where she will be better able to serve her customers.
She is requesting 3000 soles. She is very excited to know that there are people who will provide her with economic support to continue with her business. She promises to be punctual with her repayments. With the requested amount, she will buy all of the necessary ingredients to continue with her business, such as potato, rice, oil, and meat.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food for her business.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El señor Jose, habita en la comunidad llamada Buenos Aires del municipio de Tiucnatepe, junto a su esposa sueña  con poder mejorar sus condiciones de Vida y darle a su hijos un futuro mejor, a el se dificulta recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para comprar los materiales y continuar construyendo su casa, con este nuevo credito el señor Jose compra los siguientes Materiales: Bloques, Cemento, Perlines, Arena, Pidrin, etc. Agradece le apoyo que Afodenic le ha brindado en conjunto a Fondos Kiva. ya que gracias a ellos su economia es un poco mejor y su calidad de vida a mejorardo
texts.en: Jose lives in the community called Buenos Aires, of the municipality of Ticuantepe, with his wife. He dreams of being able to improve his quality of life and give his children a better future. It was difficult for him to collect enough money to buy materials and continue building his house. With this loan, Jose will buy the following materials: blocks, cement, purlins, sand, gravel, etc. He appreciates the support that Afodenic and Kiva Funds have provided to him. Thanks to them, his finances are better and his quality of life is improving.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31-year-old single man living alone in a southern Lebanese town. He owns a small coffee and hookah lounge, which is his only financial resource and support. Thus, he needs to maximize his output in order to raise his revenue and increase the number of his customers. 

Al Majmoua has been helping him in every step of the way, from actually opening up the business to financing his merchandise. Ali contacted Al Majmoua a fifth time in order to purchase hookahs, tobacco, juice, coffee, and many other products that would help him increase his revenue. 

As for the future, Ali wishes to expand and enlarge his coffee shop.

loans.use: to purchase hookahs, tobacco, juice, coffee, and many other products that would help him increase his revenue.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 62 year-old widowed mother of 6 children, living with four of her children in a village in Mount Lebanon. She works as a sales manager in her own company where she sells tupperware, and has been working in this field for 10 years now. Her children also work and own their own businesses. She decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to help her son keep up his business. In fact, her son owns a small convenience shop and is in heavy need of financial assistance. It would improve the socioeconomic situation of the family.

loans.use: to help her son keep up his business

loans.name: Battor

texts.en:
Mr. Battor is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife Yanjmaa stays home taking care of the family while she tailors traditional and modern clothes for customers' orders. His children both study at local schools.

Battor has run his taxi service business in town since 2000 and has worked at a local auto repair company for years; he also purchased a second-hand truck to provide transportation service between the provincial center and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. A well-experienced driver, Battor is requesting a loan of 2,300,000 MNT to purchase silk, cotton and other material for his wife to expand her tailoring business to increase family income.

Battor's family is hardworking, friendly and positive.

loans.use: to purchase silk, cotton and other material for his wife to expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan Pablo, es un humilde trabajador en albañilería, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte una zona con alto índice de pobreza, Juan tiene a su cargo a su pequeño hijo de 7 años de edad, su esposa se dedica a vender cosméticos por catálogos por encargos. El solicita el crédito para mejorar su vivienda haciendo un cuarto que hará poco a poco, con sus propias manos siendo su profesión albañil lo que le facilita ahorrarse el gasto en mano de obra.
texts.en: Juan Pablo is a humble builder. He lives in the Laureles Norte neighbourhood in an area with a high rate of poverty. Juan has his young 7-year-old child under his care. His wife sells cosmetics on order through catalogues. Juan Pablo is requesting a loan to improve his home by building a room bit by bit, with his own hands. Because he is a builder, he will save on labour costs.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, and blocks.

loans.name: Zhulieta

texts.en:
Zhulieta and her small family live in the village of Tsovagyugh, which is in the Gegharkunik region. She is 60 years old and she lives with her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Her husband unfortunately died very young and she has brought up her son alone. Now her son is in the Russian Federation, working abroad, and he does everything he can for somehow improving his family's living conditions. 

Zhulieta has no higher education and for several years she worked as a baker. Now her occupation is her farm, and her daughter-in-law helps her very much. They keep a cow, two bulls, one piglet and twenty-five chickens. On their plot of land they cultivate mainly potatoes, keep a little part for herbs and another part for family use.

Zhulieta wants to cooperate with Kiva lenders and is asking for a loan of 200,000 Armenian drams in order to be able to buy animal fodder for the winter months, which will be a great support for her.

loans.use: To buy animal fodder for the winter months.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33 years of age. He is married and blessed with two children. Both his children attend school. For more than ten years he has been selling tomatoes at a market in town. He lives in Mombasa, Kenya, together with his wife and their children. He has one person employed who helps in running the tomato business. 

David wants to start selling tomatoes wholesale, and that has been his vision. In the next five years he hopes to open a wholesale depot of tomatoes. There have been challenges in his business. Competition is one challenge that he deals with every day. Also customers who buy on credit sometimes do not pay him in good time. 

He knows Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy 10 crates of tomatoes for resale. The extra income raised from the loan will go towards paying his children's school fees and improving their living standards.

loans.use: to buy 10 crates of tomatoes.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang, 41,  lives in Gamarjveba village, Gardabani district, with his wife and two children. The children are 12 and 13 years old. Vakhtang requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions.
 
The family owns a milk cow. They milk the cow every day, and they produce dairy products. The products are sold at the local markets. The family has some additional income, in the form of monthly remittances from Vakhtang’s mother, who is working abroad. The family's total income is so small, that it is rarely enough to provide food for them.

Vakhtang requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to other credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit, Vakhtang will purchase a car. He will drive the car as a taxi. Vakhtang is a very hardworking man. He will work long hours, to earn a good profit and increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will give Vakhtang an opportunity to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase a car, for use as a taxi

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 36 years old. She is married with four children. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. She has been running her business for the past five years. The profits from the business will be used to buy hens and goats for rearing.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is one of the prospective students who will study management commerce and harbor administration at the Nusantara Maritime Academy. She wants to be a reliable and professional employee at a large harbor office. 

Helen's parents are just merchants, and her parents try to make every effort to help Helen achieve her goals. The economic conditions of her parents are currently uncertain because now the prices of goods are more expensive. 

Helen is worried about continuing her studies. She hopes to get a loan from Kiva to help finance her studies and to ease the burden on her parents. 

Helen is very grateful to the lenders, though not personally known to her, because she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay education fees for three years.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol,  maiz y yuca, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su familia en casa propia con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de su casa, el cliente está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: herbicidas, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y poder mejorar el terreno donde desea hacer su siembra que es el que muestra en la fotografía ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener mejores cosechas y para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The client is a farmer who has been growing beans, corn, and yuca (cassava) for several years, and with the profits from the sale of his crop he manages to cover his household expenses. He is a responsible, honest, and hardworking man who lives with his family in their own home. He uses his earnings to help with household expenses. 

The client is requesting a loan in order to purchase supplies for his crop, such as herbicides, manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc. as well as to improve the land (shown in the photo) where he would like to plant the seeds. His current earnings would not cover these expenses. This is the client's only source of income, and having better harvests would give his family more financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides, manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc., and to improve the land

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en: Kamel is a 55-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a baker for over 13 years. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. With his loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., he will develop his shop and increase his productivity by purchasing a baking machine. His bakery is an important source of income for his family. Kamel is very positive about the coming years and plans to expand his operation by opening a restaurant on the same lot where his bakery is located.

loans.use: purchasing a baking machine

loans.name: Octovianus

texts.en:
Octovianus is a fourty four year old man who has recently married Martha. Together they have six children: Yohanes who is seventeen years old and attends senior year of high school; Jufentus, fourteen years old, and Angel, thirteen years old, both of whom are junior high school students; Maria, ten years old, and Melania, eight years old, who are both in elementary school and finally Rio who is four years old.

Octovianus owns a truck business which earns an income to the amount of IDR 500,000 a day. This helps him cover his family's needs and children's school fees. Last month, his truck had to be repaired, which meant that he had no money to pay for his children's school fees. Therefore he has asked for an individual loan in the amount of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. He hopes that the his truck will be fixed shortly and can eventually enable him to repay his loan from TLM.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 51 years old and married with two children.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like snack foods, laundry soap, soft-drinks, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

Violeta has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 24 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Violeta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like snack foods, laundry soap, soft-drinks, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 33. She is a mother of three children. They all go to school. With the loan, she wants to buy more goats and sorghum for sale. She plans to renovate the house from the profits.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and goats for sale.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 42 years old. She lives in the small village of Kharagauli District with her husband, two children and mother-in-law, who is provided with a retirement pension. Lali requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from their agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milking cow, a calf and 2 buffaloes. Besides this they have 0.5 hectares of agricultural land, where nut trees are grown. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Lali requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Lali has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Lali will purchase a car. She plans to begin trade of fruits and vegetables. Her husband will drive the car and transport fruits and vegetables to different villages for selling. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and begin trade of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 36 years old and has owned a retail food business for the past five years. She has requested a loan to buy more rice, sugar and flour for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and flour for sale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, tiene 52 años, es viuda y vive en su casa propia con sus dos hijos y nietos. Ana se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para damas caballeros y niños, ella elabora  las prendas que sus clientes le solicitan a pedido o también elabora con frecuencia algunas prendas que ella misma diseña, fabrica piezas en todos los colores y para todo tipo de acontecimientos. Se dedica a este trabajo más de 30 años, siempre ha trabajado sola y afirma que nunca tuvo algún reclamo por parte de sus clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede plasmar en un prenda el diseño en el que se inspira, la facilidad que tiene de crear algo nuevo le hace sentir útil siempre; espera pronto construir un taller de costura mucho más grande. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales.  Con el monto comprará cierta cantidad de telas e hilos que necesita para confeccionar algunas prendas que pondrá a la venta.
texts.en:
Ana, 52, is a widow and lives in her own home with her two children and grandchildren. Ana makes clothes for ladies, gentlemen and children. 

She makes the clothes to order and sometimes also makes clothing of her own design. She makes items in all colours and for all kinds of occasion. She has been doing this job for over 30 years, she has always worked alone and confirms that she has had no complaints from her customers.

Her favourite thing about her job is that she can form the design from anything that inspires her, her ability to create something new always makes her feel useful. She hopes to soon build a much bigger sewing workshop.

On this occasion she is requesting 500 PEN, she is grateful for the opportunity that it offers her to make her plan a reality. With the money she will buy some thread and fabrics that she needs for sewing some items that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Jenny Del Carmen

texts.es: Jenny, es una jovencita de 29 años de edad, habita en el barrio villa Venezuela una zonda donde hay mucha pobreza y delincuencia, es casada no tiene hijos aun, ella estudia la carrera de medicina y a la vez se dedica a su pequeño negocio de pulpería su único medio de generar ingresos con el que paga sus estudios y gastos del hogar. Solicita el crédito para invertir en la venta con productos de mayor demanda por los clientes del barrio.
texts.en:
Jenny is a 29-year-old woman. She lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood, which is an area with a lot of poverty and crime. She is married and does not yet have children. 

She is studying to be a doctor and, at the same time, she makes a living by running a small grocery store. This is her only way of generating income, and she pays for her classes and household expenses with the money that she earns. She requests this loan to invest in the products that are in high demand by the people in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, canned goods, dairy products, and candy.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 23 year-old single man from Lebanon. He cooperates financially with his family’s members to be able to pay their heavy life expenses. He has owned a shop since 2011 where he serves hubble-bubble, a Lebanese traditional tobacco. He distributes to a wide range of clients in his village and its neighborhoods. Today, he is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to renovate his shop and furnish it with chairs, tables and other equipment in order to welcome customers properly and allow them to enjoy his services in a comfortable place. In the future, he plans to borrow another Kiva loan so he can expand his business further.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and furnish it with chairs, tables and other equipment

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en: Rajaa is a 45-year-old married mother of two children. She owns a small home business where she trades and sells used clothes and shoes.  Her husband works in construction. Both her children are enrolled in public schools in order to provide them with a good education, since the highest degree Rajaa ever got was intermediate. She decided to contact Al Majmoua to acquire a loan in order to purchase tiles for the new shop she is planning on opening up. As for the future, Rajaa wishes to expand her business by further enhancing her new shop.

loans.use: to purchase tiles for the new shop she is planning on opening up.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 57 years old man from the Usenge region in Kisumu. He supports 7 people in his family. He is married with five children.

Michael has a tailoring stall, a business he has been doing for the last 10 years, and generates a monthly income of KES 45000. He has applied for his fourth loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase another sewing machine and increase the value of his stock. He will use the anticipated profit to invest back into the business.

Michael's dream is to expand his business and have a his own tailoring center within the region as well as nurture his family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for his business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a single mother of two children who are in school. She sells second hand clothes in Nakuru town.She has applied for her second loan from Kadet ltd to enable her to buy more stock of clothes for sale. With the anticipated profit, she hopes to buy a motorbike.

She hopes to educate her children and see her business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 27-year-old man from Isampin, located in Kilgoris. He supports five people in his family. He is married to Mary who is a business lady. Together they have four children: 8, 6, 4, and 2 years old.

Daniel has been a small-scale farmer for the last eight years and generates a monthly income of 1,500 KES. He has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase farm inputs. He will use the anticipated profit to improve his agricultural products and farm management.

His dream is to become a successful farmer and to take good care of his family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Battseren

texts.en:
Mr. Battseren is a 38-year-old man living with his wife and their two children in an apartment in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Nyamsuren, works at a local company, while his two children study at local schools.

In 2006, he started a transportation service business. He now works at a local company as a contractor.

He explains that his vehicle has aged in recent years and needs to be replaced in order to continue to help his business. As a result, he is now requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase a better second-hand truck so that he can continue to provide transportation services in town. He is a well-experienced, hardworking and welcoming man.

loans.use: to continue to provide transportation services in town by purchasing a better second-hand truck

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie, 49, is a married woman with three children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Virgie has a business farming ornamental plants in the Philippines. Virgie requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials and supplies for her business.

Virgie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Virgie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for her ornamental plant business

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 38 years old and married with two children who are in school.

Lorena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional retail stock to sell like chips, canned goods, milk and shampoo.

Lorena has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns income from farming sugarcane.

She is now requesting a new loan to build her general store and farming sugarcane business.

Lorena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional retail stock to sell like chips, canned goods, milk and shampoo.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 36 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 12 and 14. Both of her children are enrolled in school. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more corn, peanuts, and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more corn, sorghum, and peanuts for sale.

loans.name: Rapuncel

texts.en:
Rapuncel is a 25-year-old single woman. She works very hard to help her parents.

Rapuncel runs a general store in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 5 years.

Rapuncel is requesting a loan in the amount of 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy various items to sell to her customers, including shampoo, chips, milk, noodles, eggs, and spices. In the future, Rapuncel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., shampoo, chips, milk, noodles, eggs, and spices)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Costasie

texts.en: Costasie is 53 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business successfully for many years. She has requested the loan to buy more beans, sorghum and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum and maize to sell.

loans.name: Bitractor Group

texts.en:
Deborah, a member of Bitractor Group, is a single mother of four who lives in Nansana, a Kampala City suburb. She deals in garments of different designs. She looks at her children’s education as her major priority since she does not have any other inheritance to distribute to them later in their lifetime. She believes that with education they will be able to fend for themselves.

She has now applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy better and unique garments to meet the changing tastes and preferences of her customers. This will enable her to be more competitive in the market. Deborah is grateful to Ugafode for having funded her through the group even when she had no collateral, which is unlike other institutions. She is pledging that she and the group members will pay well to maintain the partnership.

loans.use: To buy more garment to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina con 33 años de edad es una mujer agricultora y ama de casa madre de 2 hijos los cuales están en primaria cursando diferentes grados de educación y en compañía de su esposo trabajan el cultivo y siembra de café, maíz y frijol. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo terminar gracias al apoyo financiero por parte de sus padres mismos que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy temprana edad y en compañía de su esposo hace más de 10 años. En su familia y en la de su pareja la agricultura es una tradición familiar y en su comunidad es el único medio de ingreso económico para cada una de las familias incluyendo la de ella. La tierra que trabajan en compañía de su esposo es propia ya que pudieron comprarla hace algún tiempo y en sus planes están los de hacerla seguir creciendo. 

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra de insumos los cuales darán firmeza y energía a sus cultivos para su crecimiento y desarrollo.

Sus planes a futuro son los de seguir aumentando sus cultivos y su tierra, como también los de poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que ellos puedan estudiar carreras a nivel universitario que ayuden a su desarrollo y a su crecimiento tanto moral como financiero.
texts.en:
Marina, age 33, is a farmer and housewife. She has two children in different grades of elementary school. She and her husband cultivate coffee, corn, and beans. She completed her elementary school education thanks partially to her parents' financial support. Her parents also taught her to work the land at a very young age. She and her husband have farmed together for over ten years. Agriculture is a family tradition in her family and in her husband's family; in her community, it is the only source of income for all of the families, including hers. The land that she and her husband work is their own; they were able to buy it some time ago. They plan to keep expanding it.
She has requested a loan from COMIXMUL for the purchase of supplies to strengthen her crops for their growth and development.
Her plans for the future are to continue increasing her crops and her land, and to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they can go to university. She wants to support their growth and development, both morally and financially.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for maintaining her coffee crops.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is a 26-year-old Maasai from Tanzania. His hometown is situated in Simanjiro, South of Mount Kilimanjaro. Like many men of his tribe, he moved to the big city Dar es Salaam to try his luck as a security guard. For his job he earns about 100 USD per month. Despite this bad income, there was something good about the job: during the time he got in contact with many English speaking people and that's why he is (apart from Maasai language and Swahili) also fluent in English.

However, "a real Maasai doesn't belong to big cities like this," Micah says, and it is clear that he wants to go back to Simanjiro, even though he has some concerns about home. One of these big concerns in Micah's home village is lack of electricity: people need to light up their houses with kerosene lamps, which are very unhealthy and also really expensive. 

Therefore, Micah wants to start his own social business and bring affordable solar energy to his family members and friends. African Solar Rise helped him to write a business plan and provided him with technical training as well as sales training.

With a loan we do not only empower Micah to start his own social business; we also reach all of his family members (and Maasai normally have big families!) and provide them with renewable, clean, and sustainable energy.

Because of his good reputation as a guard and our personal experiences with him during our training sessions, where he showed some admirable entrepreneurial capabilities, we are confident that the loan will be fully repaid after a little more than one year.

loans.use: to buy solar products for resale

loans.name: Ergashoy

texts.ru: Эргашой весёлая и очень добрая  женщина  в возрасте 55 лет. Она замужем и имеет единственного сына, который работает в России на стройке. Эргашой всегда мечтала, чтобы её сын стал образованным и работал по своей профессии. Но сейчас из-за недостаточности финансов в семье, он вынужден был поехать в Россию на заработки. Там он получает хорошую заработную плату и каждый месяц по возможности присылает денежные средства своим родителям. Сама Эргашой тоже не сидит без дела, она швея, работает у себя на дому, шьёт разные национальные вещи, матрацы и прочие. От этого дела она также получает нормальный доход. Муж Эргашой работает инженером техником на автобазе и зарабатывает очень мало, но и этот доход является дополнительным для бюджета семьи. Весь доход, который имеется у неё в семье тратится на проживание. Но они мечтают отремонтировать свой дом, в котором живут. Состояние этого дома не совсем благоприятно для проживания. Из-за частых дождей, крыша совсем исхудала и пропускает воду во время  дождей. Поэтому Эргашой с мужем решили заняться ремонтом своего дома. И сейчас Эргашой обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит для покупки строительных материалов на ремонт своего дома. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Ergashoy is an upbeat and very kind woman, 55 years of age. She is married and has one son, who works in Russia as a construction worker. Ergashoy’s dream has always been for her son to receive an education and become a professional. But for the time being, due to lack of finances in the family, he was forced to go to Russia as a migrant worker. He receives a good salary and tries to send some money to his parents every month. Ergashoy herself does not remain idle, either: she is a seamstress working out of her home. She sews traditional national outfits, blankets etc. She also receives a decent income from this work. Ergashoy’s husband works as an engineering technician at a car park and earns very little, but this income too supplements the family budget. All of their income is spent on everyday needs. Yet they dream of renovating the house they live in. The house’s condition is unfavorable. Due to frequent rains, the roof is badly worn out and leaks during rain. This is why Ergashoy and her husband decided to renovate their house. And so Ergashoy has applied to Arvand in order to receive a loan to buy construction material and renovate her home. She thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy novelty items and toys.

loans.name: Lucia Fredesvinda

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer de 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposo y sus cinco hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Lucia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Lucia trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de sembrado, cosecha, riego y otros, Lucia trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Lucia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de variedad de abarrotes y bebidas, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder tener un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, de esta manera Lucia con ayuda de sus hijos podrá seguir trabajando y atendiendo su negocio para así poder contar con mayores ingresos económicos, los mismos que le ayudarán de mucho para lograr su gran sueño de darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Lucía is 47 and lives in the town of Ica, in the Santiago district, with her husband and their five children, whom she loves and who are her main reason for living. She is a very nice, hard-working, enthusiastic person, who, together with her husband, does her utmost to make her family's life better. Unfortunately, due to her lack of financial resources and the fact that she had to start working at a very young age to help her parents, Lucía was not able to complete her studies in order to learn a profession. In her spare time, she likes to watch television, and she sometimes cooks a delicious duck-and-rice dish called 'arroz con pato', which she shares with her family. On her own initiative, and with lots of effort and dedication, Lucía works as a farm hand for an agricultural cooperative in her town. She sows, reaps, waters, and does other such tasks. She works about ten hours a day and attributes her success to her hard work and her amiability towards other people. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy various types of groceries and drinks, which she will use to open a convenience store. Thus, with the help of her sons, she will be able to both work and tend to the shop, in order to increase her income and make her greatest dream, that of being able to afford a good education for her sons, come true.

loans.use: to buy various types of groceries and drinks.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman, who works hard to support her family.

She operates a general store business in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for two years.

Lorna is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, including soaps, milk, canned goods, eggs, and sugar. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., soaps, milk, canned goods, eggs, and sugar)

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is 20 years old.

She owns a boutique business, which she has been running for the past seven years.

With the requested loan proceeds, she wants to buy more rice and soaps for re-sale purposes. She explains that the profits she generates from the business as a result of the loan will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To expand her retail business by purchasing additional rice and soaps.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is a 44-year-old married woman. She and her husband, who is a farmer, have seven children.

She has been selling cattle and goats for ten years.

With the requested loan proceeds, she would like to buy more cattle and goats for re-sale purposes. The profits she generates from the business as a result of the loan will be used to renovate her family's house.

loans.use: To purchase additional cattle and goats for sale.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is married and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristy is 27 years old and has two children who are in school.

Cristy has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Cristy requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Cristy has been in this business for two years. In the future, Cristy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela, de 33 años, es divorciada y vive en su casa propia con sus 3 hijos.
