Ángela se dedica a la venta de bebidas regionales, cada uno de sus refrescos son elaborados con las frutas más frescas y saludables que consigue en el mercado. Su tienda esta en un esquina donde ay mucho comercio y continuamente transitada por la población de la ciudad. Inicialmente vendía en la puerta de su casa, más adelante lo hizo por toda la ciudad llevando sus baldes con refresco en una carretilla, pero ahora tiene su puesto gracias a un convenio con la Municipalidad del distrito. Lleva 20 años haciendo lo mismo, ha trabajado siempre sola y aunque ahora le va muy bien, reconoce que al principio tuvo muchas dificultades. Está muy contenta porque la rentabilidad de este trabajo le permitió realizar muchos cambios en la mejora de las condiciones de vida de su hogar.Le gusta mucho lo que hace, le agrada conversar con sus clientes y de esta forma conocer sus preferencias y gustos de sabores, más adelante desea tener una tienda o fuente de soda donde pueda vender mayor variedad de refrescos y helados de frutas regionales y no solo limitarse a bebidas típicas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su  préstamo que necesita para cumplir con sus objetivos laborales. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de las frutas y demás ingredientes que necesita para continuar vendiendo sus refrescos y una congeladora pequeña para mantener sus productos siempre fríos.
texts.en:
Ángela, age 33, is divorced and lives in her own home with her three children. She sells local drinks, all made from the freshest and tastiest fruits that she can buy in the market. Her store is located on a busy corner. She started off selling from the door of her home, and then later started selling all over the city, carrying buckets full of drinks in a little wheelbarrow. Now, though, she has a storefront thanks to an agreement with the local municipality.
She has had this business for ten years. She has always worked alone, and even though it is going very well for her now, she recognizes that she had many difficulties in the beginning. She is very happy because the profits from this business allow her to make a lot of changes and to improve her quality of life and her home.
She really enjoys what she does. She enjoys talking to her customers and getting to know their preferences and which flavours they like. In the future, she wants to have a store or a soda fountain where she can offer a greater variety of drinks and ice creams made from regional fruit. She would like to not be limited to traditional drinks.
She is requesting 2500 soles. She is grateful to everyone who is making her loan possible; she needs it to achieve her work goals. She will invest this loan in the purchase of the fruits and other ingredients that she needs to keep selling her drinks. She will also purchase a small freezer to keep her products cold all the time.

loans.use: to  buy fruit and other ingredients for making juice for her store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, age 30, earns a low wage as a worker. This is the only source of income for his family. He lives in a small house with his wife and their child in the city of Rafah. 

Because the water in Rafah is not very pure, Ahmad would like to buy a water purification filter. This will provide safer, cleaner water for the family to use for drinking, cooking, and cleaning. For this purpose, Ahmad has requested a loan from FATEN. 

This investment will offer the family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a water purification filter for the family

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 27-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He lives in the refugee camps in a very simple home with his wife and their one daughter.

Ibrahim works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. He would like to improve his family's living conditions, get a better job, and earn more income, so he decided to study in the university in order to earn a higher degree.

Ibrahim is seeking a loan from FATEN. The loan proceeds will help him buy a new laptop to complete his studies at the university. By completing his studies, Ibrahim feels that he will be able to provide his family with a better life in the future.

loans.use: to complete his studies by purchasing a new laptop

loans.name: Marnie

texts.en:
Marnie is a married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a mother of three young children. For more than four years, Marnie has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband. This is the source of their income.

Marnie is asking for a loan to buy a new engine for their fishing boat and fishing nets. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market. Marnie wants to save money for the future schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for their fishing boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Elisa works hard to support her family in the Philippines.

She operates a business where she buys and sells bananas, firewood, and charcoal. She also earns additional income from tricycle transportation services.

Elisa is seeking to borrow 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more firewood, charcoal, and bananas to sell. Notably, Elisa successfully repaid her previous loans and is now requesting this new loan to further expand her business. Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through 21 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, which she believes will secure her family's future.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional stocks of firewood, charcoal, and bananas to sell

loans.name: Charry

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Charry works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. Charry is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, sugar, canned goods, etc. for her general store.

Charry has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Graciela

texts.es: Rosa comenzó su negocio hace 15 años, a trabajar en una empresa camaronera, pero debido a una reducción de personal perdió su trabajo, con su liquidación decidió emprender una tienda de abarrotes, con el transcurrir de los años pudo tener mas clientes actualmente su negocio es muy conocido en el sector lo que le permite tener mejores ingresos económicos, con el préstamo comprara mas productos de consumo masivo, su sueño es mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Rosa started her business 15 years ago.  She used to work for a shrimp company.  However, due to a reduction in personnel, she lost her job.  With her severance pay she decided to establish a grocery store.  As the years passed, she was able to have more customers.  Her business is now very well-known in the area.  This allows her to have better income.  She will use the loan to buy more mass consumer products.  Her dream is to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy more mass consumer products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up with seasonal shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the deeds to her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a bedroom.

loans.name: Gaviotas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
"Gaviotas (Flat)" es un grupo integrado por 8 personas alegres y emprendedoras, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Vista Hermosa, para poder llegar a la comunidad se toma un autobús que te deja en la carretera y debes caminar alrededor de 20 minutos más. La principal fuente de empleo es el campo en la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar.

La señora Cecilia  tiene la edad de 32 años, estudio hasta el segundo grado de secundaria y esta casada con el señor Juan con el cual tiene 4 hijos: Juan Carlos, Eduardo, Cecilia e Imelda. 

Doña Cecilia platica que hace mas de tres años inició con su negocio de venta de dulces de repostería(cocadas, camotes y dulces de leche), ella vende casa por casa en su comunidad y algunas veces se va a otras comunidades como La Reforma, La Atalaya y Loma Alta a vender sus dulces, ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio porque quiere ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Doña Cecilia desea darles un profesión a sus hijos pero también sabe que solo lo logrará trabajando con entusiasmo junto a su esposo. 

Un crédito de Kiva y VisionFund le ayudará a comprar variedad de dulces para su posterior venta.
Ella también  dice que se encuentra agradecida con las instituciones ya que con este préstamo su negocio prosperara para poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos como tanto lo desea.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Maria Sugey venta de calzado 
Maria Angélica venta de ropa 
Julia venta de refrescos 
Gabriela venta de ropa 
Mauricio venta de pollo y cría de cerdos
Roberta venta de pollo
Minerva venta de papelería
texts.en:
“Gaviotas (Flat)” (“Gaviotas” means “seagulls”) is a group made up of 8 happy and entrepreneurial people. This group is located in the community of Vista Hermosa. In order to be able to get to the community, you take a bus that leaves you on the highway, and you should walk about 20 more minutes. The main source of employment is the land, planting and growing sugar cane.

Cecilia is 32 years old. She studied through the second year of secondary school and she is married to Juan, with whom she has 4 children: Juan Carlos, Eduardo, Cecilia, and Imelda.

Cecilia says that more than three years ago she started her business selling sweets (cocadas [coconut macaroons], camotes [sweet potato candy], and dulce de leche candies). She sells door to door in her community and sometimes she goes to other communities like La Reforma, La Atalaya, and Loma Alta to sell her sweets. She decided to start her own business because she wants to help her husband with the household expenses and give her children a better quality of life. Cecilia wants to give her children a profession, but she also knows that she will only achieve that by working enthusiastically with her husband.

A loan from Kiva and VisionFund will help her to buy a variety of sweets to sell.

She also says that she is grateful to the institutions, since with this loan her business will prosper so that she can offer her children a better quality of life, as she wants so much to do.

The other members of the group are:
Maria Sugey: selling shoes
Maria Angélica: selling clothing
Julia: selling soft drinks
Gabriela: selling clothing
Mauricio: selling chicken and raising pigs
Roberta: selling chicken
Minerva: selling stationery

loans.use: to buy a variety of sweets

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, a sus 45 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol tiene 25 años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, Misael se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que aprovechar las oportunidades lo llevaran un paso más adelante del éxito; en la última siembra no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas y esta vez quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, fertilizante, abonos, herbicidas, herramientas, etc. y mejorar el terreno  que muestra la fotografía que es donde desea hacer su siembra. Misael  tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Misael lives with his partner and their child. He is 45 and cultivates corn and beans. He has been a farmer for 25 years, so he has a great deal of experience in the field. He is very well-known in the area and has a good clientele because he has the best harvests and sells products of the highest quality and at very accessible prices. He also provides unequalled service. Misael is known for being very kind. He is an enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead. He believes that taking advantage of opportunities will bring him one step closer to success. In the last harvest, he did not obtain the income he had expected, and this time he wants to increase production. In order to do this, he needs capital. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL for the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, manure, herbicides, tools, etc. He will also use it to improve the plot of land in the photo, which is where he wants to sow. Misael's references say that he has an irreproachable character, and that he is responsible and repays his loans. He is confident that he will be able to pay off the debt and, at the same time, provide his family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, herbicides, tools, etc.

loans.name: Osita

texts.en:
Osita is a fish vendor. She has been engaged in this business for the past six years and works hard to help support her family. She and her husband have nine children.

Osita has successfully repaid her previous loan from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., and has now requested a PhP 10,000 loan. She will use her loan funds to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

She would like to build and expand her business to help secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Pierre Claver

texts.en:
Pierre Claver, age 40, owns and operates a bar to earn an income. He has run his business for the past three years.

Pierre has requested a loan in order to buy more beer and soft drinks to offer for sale at his establishment. The increased profits expected from the loan investment will be used to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Гулдаста жизнерадостная женщина в возрасте 49 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Супруг Гулдасты уже несколько лет находится на заработках в России. Там он работает строителем и получает хороший доход. Каждый месяц он присылает деньги своей жене на проживание. Но этих денег не хватает на удовлетворение всех потребностей семьи, поэтому Гулдаста вынуждена заниматься своим бизнесом, чтобы поддерживать семейный бюджет. Гулдаста занимается реализацией хозяйственных товаров. Опыт в этой сфере у неё 8 лет. С 2009 года она сотрудничает с Арванд, получает кредит для реализации своего бизнеса. На данный момент она арендует магазин вблизи своего дома. В ассортименте её продаж большое количество хозяйственных и подарочных наборов, подарочные ножи, часы, музыкальные инструменты,  а  также  кастрюли, казаны и прочие. Большую часть своей выручки Гулдаста пускает в оборот, увеличивая ассортимент товаров. Свой товар она закупает у поставщиков из Китая и на оптовом рынке и потом продаёт в своём магазине для местного населения. С целью расширения ассортимента и оборота своего бизнеса Гулдаста хочет получить кредит. Для этого она обратилась в Арванд и желает получить кредит для покупки хозяйственных товаров. Гулдаста выражает свою благодарность Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Guldasta is a cheerful woman who is 49 years old and married with three children.  Her husband has been a migrant worker in the Russian Federation for a few years now.  He is a builder and earns a good income there.  Every month he sends money to his wife for living expenses, but it is not enough to meet all of her family's needs, so Guldasta had to start her own business to support the family budget.  Guldasta sells household goods and she has been in this line of work for eight years.  Since 2009, she has worked with Arvand, receiving loans to help her run her business.  At the moment, she rents a shop near her home.  Her assortment of goods includes a large collection of household and gift items, souvenir knives, watches and musical instruments, as well as skillets, pots and other goods.  Guldasta reinvests the main part of her income back into her business to increase her assortment of goods.  She buys her goods from wholesale suppliers in China and then resells them to the locals at her shop.  She wants to receive a loan to she can expand her range of goods and increase turnover.  She has turned to Arvand so she can receive a loan to buy household goods.  Guldasta sends her thanks to Arvand for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her shop.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now she lives in the Fizuli region with her family. Naila is 57 years old, married, and has a daughter. Her daughter goes to a music university and she wants to be a pianist. Naila started her business seven years ago in food production and sales. 

Now Naila needs a loan of 2,300 AZN to buy a fridge to keep her products cold. She wants to use the money to buy a piano for her daughter. In the future, Naila wants to have new and different products for sale. This will be more profitable for her business. Naila is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy a fridge

loans.name: Wilmer Antonio

texts.es: Wilmer se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, cuando ha pasado la cosecha se  dedica a trabajar de jornal en una finca que está cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con el pago de su trabajo  logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar , vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, wilmer está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, herramientas, etc.  y asi poder tener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Wilmer has been working in agriculture for several years, which has given him the ability and knowledge to run his own crops. His main cultivations are corn and beans, and he sells the product at agencies of basic grains close to where he lives. When the harvest is over, he earns wages working in a farm near his house. Thanks to the earnings he makes from sales and his wages, he's able to cover some of his household expenses. He lives with his wife and their two children. 

Wilmer is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies to help in the cultivation of his crops, such as fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, tools, etc. These will help to improve earnings and provide his family with a better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, tools, etc.

loans.name: Juan Vicente

texts.es: Don juan de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maiz, y frijol,  de esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Es un hombre luchador. Siempre está al pendiente de su familia ya que para él es su principal fuente de inspiración y desea poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar este crédito ya que la temporada en la que se realiza la siembra, se aproxima, y quiere estar preparado con los principales insumos agrícolas como: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Don Juan, age 54, lives in his own home with his wife and three children. He cultivates corn and beans. This is how he makes a living and provides his family with their daily bread. He farms year in, year out, and it is the only way he knows to make a living. He is a very hard-working, honest, and responsible man. Despite his very humble living conditions, he never gets tired of working and giving his family the best. He is a fighter. He is always looking out for his family; they are his main source of inspiration and he wants to be able to improve their living conditions. 
He has decided to approach the institution to request a loan because the sowing season is approaching, and he wants to be prepared with agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds.
He hopes to have good results because he has no other source of income. He trusts God that he will obtain an abundant harvest that will allow him to continue providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn is a married woman who works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jennylyn explains that she has been in this business for five years now, but that she also earns additional income from a general store.

Jennylyn is requesting a loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of food to sell. Notably, she successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to expand her food vending and general store business. In the future, Jennylyn would like to save enough money to further expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory of food to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles 36 years is a Ugandan citizen who resides in Kagyeyo, Kebisoni – Rukungiri District. He is a married man and a father to six (06) children of which two (02) attend school.
He is a farmer in his home place with his main business as a banana seller. He has a big banana plantation where he trades the bananas to different traders in the District who later transports them to the city (Kampala District).
Charles began this business with an aim of getting income to meet the needs of his family.However he now has challenges like the banana wilt and season fluctuations where the bananas don’t produce the desired yields. He is now taking this loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) with the aim buying another piece of land close to his homestead, this he thinks will provide more land for expanding his plantation therefore increasing the yields and in turn take great care of his wife and children's tuition.
Through agriculture, he will be able to improve on his household livelihood which calls for sustainable well being.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land

loans.name: Milijana

texts.en:
Miljana is 33-years-old and married with three children. Her children are between the ages of 4 and 12 and only two of them are attending school. Together they live in a minority community.  Miljana works as a cleaning lady in a post office and her husband is a driver in a hospital. For more than two years now Miljana has been making extra money by also running her own business shop selling different clothes and toys for children. When she first started it was a very small shop and over the years she has been able to expand the size of her shop and product. 

At this time Miljana is in need of a loan to buy an inventory of children's clothes and toys for her store. Since this loan will help her to increase income she hopes in the future to expand her business again even further and hire an employee. This will help her to achieve her goal of offering a better life to her children. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders for helping her to sustain her business.

loans.use: To by an inventory of children's clothes and toys

loans.name: Leopold

texts.en:
Leopold is a resident of Nyakanengo, a rural area in Rukungiri District. He was born in 1958, thus is 55 years of age. He is married with three children, all of whom go to school. He studied up to secondary level and then decided to take another journey of life to business.
He began planting coffee, and has operated this business until today. He works for eight hours each day, which shows that he is a hardworking person.
His main challenge is price fluctuations which affect his budget allocations. He therefore approached UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for a loan to buy cement and hire labour to plaster his family residential house so that it looks better and is decent enough to house the family. He will use the money from the coffee sales to pay back the loan. His dream is to educate his children and expand his business to be sustainable.

loans.use: To plaster his residential house

loans.name: Erine

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erine works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food sales.

Erine is seeking to borrow 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell, including like soaps, shampoo, milk, sugar, cream, and noodles, for her general store business. Erine has been sustaining her business activities through two prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her child to college.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., soaps, shampoo, milk, sugar, cream, and noodles)

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, age 63, fattens and sells pigs to earn an income. She has been engaged in this agricultural business for the past 27 years. 

She and her husband have four children.

Erlinda has taken out 26 loans in the past and has used her loan funds to sustain and stabilize her business. She is presently requesting a PhP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies.
 
Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Guarambare Group

texts.es:
Inician el primer ciclo son 16 integrantes es el desafío de este grupo que está iniciando llamado Guarambare, donde cada una de ellas quiere ayudar a sus familias y es por ello que están con un entusiasmo tan grande. También trabajan en conjunto para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Tomasa es una de estas mujeres, quien se encarga de la venta de leche y de queso, en su trabajo ella se destaca, ya que sus clientes siempre están muy contentos con lo que vende, ya que son de primera calidad. Empieza su día desde muy tempranas horas, y lucha sin parar.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche para la venta, ya que de esta forma podrá seguir mejorando la calidad de sus productos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras reciben.
texts.en:
Starting its first loan cycle with 16 members is the challenge for this group named Guarambare. Each member wants to help her family. For this reason, they have a great amount of enthusiasm. They also work together so that they can improve their quality of life.

Tomasa is one of these women. She is known for her work of selling milk and cheese. Her customers are always pleased with what she sells since her products are of the highest quality. Tomasa begins her day in the early morning hours and continues without stopping. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of milk to sell. This will enable her to continue improving the quality of her products. Tomasa is grateful for this opportunity that she and her fellow group members have received.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Zef

texts.en:
With a prior loan extended to Zef, he was able to buy baby turkeys. (Zef is pictured next to the turkeys that he bought with proceeds from the previous loan, thanks to all of you lenders.) He would like to express his deep gratitude for your prior help, but he also wants to ask for your help once again.

He is seeking a loan to buy food for his animals. The amount that he needs now is 100,000 Albanian Lek.

loans.use: To purchase food for turkeys that he purchased with proceeds from a prior loan

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Vicenta requested a PHP 35000 loan through NWTF to buy food and household goods like soap, chips, noodles, eggs, spices, etc. to sell.

Vicenta has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Vicenta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy food and household goods like soap, chips, noodles, eggs, spices, etc. to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and blessed with two children. She sells imported secondhand clothes in the local market. She has one employee who helps her run the business. She has been in the clothes business for more than ten years. The 45-year-old heard of Milango through friends and she decided to join so that she could access credit for her business. She now seeks a loan to buy six bales of secondhand clothes. She also runs a public transport vehicle which gives her extra income. She says that when it rains it becomes very difficult to get customers. The other challenge is that prices fluctuate and this sometimes brings losses. The extra income that she will get will pay her children's school fees and improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy six bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Dilia Santos

texts.es: Dilia de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 10 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dilia, 42, lives in her own home with her husband and son, she owns a shop where she sells staple goods: beans, milk, eggs, bread and other things. She has been running her business for 10 years and this has given her sales experience, which allows her to obtain better income. The shop is located in a well-frequented area of her home town and it is well known by her neighbours and she has many customers as her store is well-stocked. 

She wants to grow her business and carry out further investment, but she needs capital to do so. This is why she has requested a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for her store. She is sure that she will be able to pay back the debt and also confides that it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, rice, oil, soups, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase items for the preparation of tamales, stuffed chiles and tacos.

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis  se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende  dentro de su comunidad al por menor; su esposo trabaja como maestro albañil en la ciudad de el Alto, Vive en casa propia con su hija. Su domicilio está ubicado  en la comunidad de Kasa Santa Rosa, del Sector Guaqui de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas y media  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector.
.
El crédito requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, etc. Así podrá  refaccionar el establo para ganado, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas. La salud de las vacas es muy importante para que la producción de leche sea de mejor calidad.

El sueño de Gertrudis, es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera    vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Gertrudis raises cattle for the production of milk, which she sells in her community at retail price. Her husband works as a master bricklayer in the city of El Alto. She lives in her own house along with her daughter. Her house is located I the community of Kasa Santa Rosa, in the Gauqui sector of the province of Ingavi, in the department of La Paz, three and half hours from the city of La Paz. She has a few head of improved breed cattle, which require a lot of care due to the climate of the sector.

She needs the loan to buy construction materials: cement, bricks, etc. With this she will be able to repair the stable for the cattle so that she can improve their production by improving their health. The health of the cows is very important to the production of better quality milk.

Gertudis’ dream is to increase her number of cattle by taking good care of their health.

This is the first time she has requested a loan with IMPRO and also the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and tin roofing sheets to repair her stable so she can keep her dairy cows healthier so they can produce more milk.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche de La Paz; vive con su familia en su domicilio propio ubicado en la comunidad de Kallutaca, del Sector  Laja de La provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; Hernan cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado alimenticio
.
El crédito requiere para comprar materiales de construcción para refaccionar su establo y así preservar la salud de su ganado manteniéndolo caliente e incrementando su producción y mejorando así sus ingresos económicos para su familia. Además Hernan tiene una segunda actividad pues él posee un minibús con el cual realiza el transporte de pasajeros interprovincial de La Paz a Laja

El sueño de Hernan  es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, y convertirse en uno de los máximos productores del sector.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Hernan raises dairy cattle for the production of milk, which he sells to one of industrial milk plants in La Paz. He lives with his family in their own house, located in the community of Kallutaca, in the Laja sector of the province of Los Andes, in the department of La Paz, an hour’s distance from the city of La Paz. Hernan has several head of improved breed cattle, which require more care with their feed.

He needs the loan to buy construction materials to repair his stable so that he can keep his cattle healthy by keeping the stable warm. This will help him increase his production and improve his income for his family. Hernan also has a second business—he has a minibus that he uses for passenger transportation between La Paz and Laja.

Hernan’s dream is increase his number of cattle and become one of the largest producers in the sector. 

This is the fourth time he has requested a loan with IMPRO and the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairing his stable so he can keep his dairy cows warmer so they can produce better quality milk.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma  se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche de La Paz. Ella  vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos; su esposo trabaja también en el matadero de la ciudad de la Paz  como empleado a destajo por cada ganado faenado la pagan un monto, su casa se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Akerana, del Sector Achacachi de La provincia Omasuyos  del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas  de distancia  de la ciudad;  cuenta con  cabezas de ganado  las cuales requieren mayor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector
.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, calamina  etc. Así podrá  refaccionar el establo para ganado, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas para que la leche que produzcan sea más limpia y de mejor calidad. 

El sueño de Emma y su familia, es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos y mejorando sus ingresos económicos.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda    vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Emma works raising cows to produce milk that she sells at one of the industrialized milk plants in La Paz. She lives in her own house with her children.  Her husband works as a slaughterhouse in La Paz as a employee paid by piecework.  For each cow slaughtered, he receives payment.  They live in the community of Akerana in the Achacachi area of the province of Omasuyos in the department of La Paz, about three hours from the city.  They have cows that require better care due to the weather conditions in their area.

She is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and corrugated iron so that she can repair the stable for the cows since that will improve production.  It will preserve the health of the cows so that the milk they produce will be cleaner and of better quality.

Emma and her family dream of increasing the number of cows they own, taking care of their good health, and improving their financial situation.  This is the second loan she has requested with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, and corrugated iron to repair her stable.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar, es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en colegio , viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la localidad de Achacachi de la Provincia Omasuyos.
El estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente se dedica a la producción de leche, junto con su  familia en la localidad de Achacachi.
El crédito lo requiere para compra de ganado mejorado, de esta manera mejorar su producción de leche y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Edgar es tener su propio centro de acopio.
Es la Segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Edgar is married and has two school-aged children.  They live in their own house which is located in the town of Achacachi in the province of Omasuyos.

He received a secondary education and currently works in milk production together with his family in Achacachi.  He is in need of a loan to buy better livestock to improve milk production, so he can improve his quality of life.

Edgar's goal is to have his own collection center one day.  This is his second loan through IMPRO and his first from KIVA.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche de La Paz. Elvis actualmente es soltero vive  en su casa de sus padres ubicada en la comunidad de Guaraya, del Sector  Tihuanaco de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas y media  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector
.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, etc. Así podrá  refaccionar el establo para ganado, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas al tener establo cerrado con mayor calor .

El sueño de Elvis, es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la  segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elvis makes a living by breeding cows for the production of milk, which he sells to one of the milk processing plants in La Paz. Elvis is currently single. He lives in his parents’ house, which his located in the community of Guaraya, in the sector of Tihuanaco in Ingavi province, in the department of La Paz. It is three and a half hours away from the city of La Paz. He has several head of crossbred cattle, which require better care given the climatic conditions of the sector.

He needs the loan in order to buy building materials, such as cement and bricks, so he can repair the stable for the cattle. He will thereby be able to improve his production and keep his cows in good health as he will have a closed stable with more warmth.

Elvis’ dream is to increase his head of cattle and ensure they are in good health. This is the second loan he is requesting from IMPRO and it is his first loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to repair his stables in order to give his cows more warmth so they produce better quality milk with less impurities

loans.name: Byambadoo

texts.en:
Byambadoo, age 54, runs his own business transporting and selling firewood. He became engaged in this kind of work in 2005, when he started working for a local company as a driver. In his new business, he transports firewood from the countryside to town, where he offers it for sale. He would like to start selling additional consumer goods as well.

Byambadoo lives with his wife Surenhorloo and their daughter in a small house in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Surenhorloo herds livestock to earn an income and their daughter is a senior student at the local university. 

Byambadoo has gained valuable experience and is a hard-working man with a positive reputation. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for his newly-starting business retailing consumer goods and firewood in town.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for his newly-starting business retailing consumer goods and firewood in town

loans.name: Nesa

texts.en:
Nesa is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been in the farming business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Nesa and her husband have six children.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this investment, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una  empresa acopiadora y procesadora de leche. El vive con su esposa y sus hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Chojñacollo, del Sector Pucarani de La provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones  geográficas y  climatológicas del sector.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, calaminas  etc. Así podrá  refaccionar el establo para su  ganado, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

El sueño de Eusebio, es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, por lo tanto su producción  precautelando la buena salud de ellos. El ganado al contar con condiciones mejores de clima (establos más calientes) mejora su producción de leche.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Guillermo raises dairy cattle and sells the milk to a milk processor and distributor.   He lives in his own home with his wife and children, in his own home in the community of Chojñacollo, in the sector of Pucarani in the province of Los Andes in the department of La Paz.  His home is three hours from the city of La Paz.

He has several well-bred head of cattle, which require a great deal of care given the geographic and climate conditions in his area.

This is his second loan he his seeking through IMPRO and his first time going through Kiva. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase construction materials such as bricks, cement and corrugated sheet metal.  He will then be able to make repairs to his cows' stable, which will keep his animals in good health and improve their production. Livestock living in better climate conditions (warmer stables) have better milk production.

His dream is to add to his livestock and keep his animals in good health.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and sheet metal to make repairs to his cows' stable so that they can have a warmer environment and produce higher quality milk.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda tiene 54 años, está separada y vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos mayores y sus nietos. Rayda se dedica a la venta de bebidas  y productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, entre otros. Su negocio está establecido en su casa, todos los días atiende muchos clientes que acuden a su tienda en busca de todo tipo de productos, siempre atiende al público con mucho cariño, respeto y amabilidad. De forma eventual realiza trabajos de costura, ya sea confeccionando prendas de su propia creación que luego pone a la venta o elaborando alguna ropa exclusiva pedida por el mismo cliente. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite dedicar su tiempo a múltiples actividades del hogar, además le está yendo muy bien ya que genera muchos ingresos para su familia, ahora tiene muchos planes para su negocio entre ellos está la ampliación de su local de atención y así poder vender en mayor cantidad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto comprará mayor cantidad de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, aceite, huevos, pan y leche para que continúe vendiendo en su tienda.
texts.en:
Rayda, 54, is separated and lives in her own home with her two adult children and her grand children. 

Rayda sells drinks and food products like rice, sugar and others for a living. Her business is set up in her home, everyday she serves lots of customers who come in search of a variety of products. She always serves her customers with care, respect and a friendly attitude. 

She also does some sewing and she makes her own items which she sells or makes items to order. 

She really likes her work as it allows her to dedicate her time to various household activities, it is also going really well and generates a lot of income for her family. She now has a lot of plans for her business, amongst others is the expansion of her store and therefore to be able to sell a greater quantity of product. 

On this occasion she is requesting 2000 PEN, she is very happy to know that she will be able to have financial support so that she will feel safe to advance her business. On the other hand she is committed once again to make her payments according to schedule. With the sum she will buy a greater quantity of food products like rice, sugar, oil, eggs, bread and milk so that she can continue selling them in her store.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred, age 30, sells second-hand and ready-made clothing items to earn an income. He has been engaged in this business for the last 10 years and generates a monthly income of KES 10,000. He lives with his wife Jael and their two small children in the Migori region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. Jael runs her own business and helps Fred in providing support for the family. Their children are two and three years old.

Fred has applied for his third loan with KADET Ltd., and he will use his loan funds to purchase more second-hand and ready-made clothing items to offer for sale. He will use the anticipated profits to boost his business.
 
Fred's dream is to expand the business so that he can earn enough of an income to ensure the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
Charina is 34 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Charina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Charina has been raising pigs for 10 years and earns additional income from making furniture and selling glass.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Renarta

texts.en:
Renarta wishes to be a student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN) and wishes to take the management programs in Commerce and Harbor Administration. Renarta wants to become an expert in the field of shipping and administration so she can work in the port.

Renarta is the third child of seven siblings and comes from Aru Islands, Maluku Province. This is known as the Maluku Island Province. She lives in the high plateaus and rugged mountains. Renarta's parents work as farmers with no fixed income. Renarta hopes to obtain a loan from Kiva investors. She wants to finish her education as quickly as possible to ease the burden on her parents, who have been financing her life. She wants to quickly get a job, so as to make her parents and siblings happy.

Renarta is very grateful to Kiva investors who will help finance her studies.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 35 years old, married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. She sells foodstuffs. With the loan, will be used to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 52 years old and married with eight children.

Susana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy food and household goods to sell like soap, spices, eggs and noodles.

Susana has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Susana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy food and household goods to sell like soap, spices, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Teodola

texts.en:
Teodola, age 71, buys and sells rice to earn an income. She has been in this business for 27 years and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She lives with her husband and family in Calatrava, Negros Occidental.

Teodola has requested a PhP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more sacks of rice to offer for sale.

Teodola would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara operates a general store business to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for four years and is a hard-working entrepreneur. She earns additional income from food vending. 

Clara has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 14,000 through NWTF, which she will use to buy additional stocks of items to offer for sale in her store, such as soap, canned goods, milk, eggs, and noodles.

Clara dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy such items as soap, canned goods, milk, eggs, and noodles to offer for sale

loans.name: Kuncup Mekar Group

texts.en:
Currently the group "Kuncup Mekar" has finished the loan cycle (first). They want to continue to cycle two by increasing the loan amount to each member. Loans from Kiva are very helpful for their businesses and the economy of their respective families. 

However, there is a change of group members. There were ten members in cycle one. For the second cycle, it was changed to eight members, and one member is a new entry. Kuncup Mekar, this group, still has a wide variety of business efforts, such as catering for offices, grocery shop, clothes and bed linens, credit, household appliances, and selling small meals or snacks. Their fellow members cooperate with each other and remind each other and support each other, so it has lasted for eight years. With this loan from Kiva, they are eager to expand their businesses, increase the types of foods, and add more equipment adequately.

The group is led by a woman named Lulu. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. Her husband works as a driver on a passenger boat. Lulu opened a catering services business in her home, and has to do all herself because she has not been able to pay auxiliary help power. 

Together with her husband, Lulu is trying to fill food orders for the offices she serves. She hopes with this loan, she can add equipment and a place to cook more rice boxes. 

They are very grateful to Kiva and have completed one cycle smoothly.

loans.use: to pay for additional equipment and a place to cook more rice boxes.

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es: Maria de 58 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años,  trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, honrada  y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo. Doña María  solicita un crédito para comprar maiz por quintales y cal,  para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a 58-year old woman who has worked selling tortillas at her house for 10 years. She works Monday through Sunday and has many clients because she's a very hardworking, responsible, honest and kind person. Thanks to the earnings she obtains, she can cover her household expenses. She lives in her own house with her husband and son. 

Maria is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk and lime, so that she can keep making tortillas, improving her income and providing her family with a better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire is aged 35. She is a mother of four children. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice and beans for sale. 

Marie Claire plans to expand her residence home using the profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and beans for sale.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 55 years old. She has been in the business of selling sodas and beer for sixteen years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sodas and beer for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate her houses.

loans.use: to buy more beer and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna earns an income by operating a general store business. She has been engaged in this venture for two years and is a hard-working entrepreneur. She earns additional income from food vending.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is requesting PhP 6,000 through NWTF in order to re-stock her store with food and household goods to offer for sale, such as soap, coffee, milk, sugar, and spices.

She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items such as soap, coffee, milk, sugar, and spices to offer for sale

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Irene works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Irene is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada has a husband and three children. Her two younger children are currently in elementary school, and her eldest is at college. She sells food and drink in her café in Mombassa, and this has been her sole source of income for four years. She employs four people in the café, and within the next five years she would like to open more outlets. 

There have been challenges in running the cafe since she has been in business. The cost of electricity and travel have become very high, and also the cost of ingredients. It is difficult to keep the food prices as low as her customers would like. 

Saada found out about Kiva's partner Milango through a group of friends who invited her to join so that she could also have the opportunity to get loans for her business. She has asked for a loan so that she can fit a glass window in her café. She wants to make her café look neat and attractive to help shake off the competition that is growing stiffer every day. The loan will help Saada to get her children through school. She also wants to improve the standards of living for her family.

loans.use: to put a glass window in her cafeteria

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 49-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been working in selling clothes, accessories and lingerie since 18 years ago. Her husband works as a taxi driver with a very low income that is not enough to cover all his family's needs.  

Both of her children work too, with very small incomes, in order to help in their family's expenses.

Amal is applying for her ninth loan cycle from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection. Her previous loans helped her a lot in responding to her family's needs and increasing her business capital.

She hopes to keep on pleasing her customers and family as much as she can. Most of her customers are relatives, neighbors and friends. But her house is located in a very high-population area, which encourages her to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 18, 16 y 5 años de edad, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y fríjol, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de compra-venta de granos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Oscar  solicita un crédito para poder mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer su siembra que es el que muestra en la fotografía  ya que los terrenos de donde el vive son muy rústicos y pedregosos y también  comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes  herbicidas, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Oscar, age 44, lives in his own home with his partner and their three children ages 18, 16, and 5. He cultivates corn and beans and sells his crops in the markets where basic staples are bought and sold. With his income from his sales he is able to cover his household costs. Oscar is requesting a loan so that he can improve the land where he plans to plant, shown in the photo. The land in the area is very coarse and rocky. He will also use the loan to purchase necessary supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides, manure, and seeds. This will allow him to obtain good harvests and a better income in order to give his family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, manure, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn. She previously accepted a loan of 20,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) that she used to buy extra stocks of toys and other products. Her additional earnings were a big help in paying for the education of her children, and also helped her to meet her personal, household and business expenses.

Analyn would now like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan, so that she can buy additional stocks of toys, pony tail holders, and different gift items. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs, and to meet the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Analyn dreams to have her own stall. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products such as toys, pony tail holders, and different gift items.

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en:
Pricilla lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and blessed with two children. She is a consultant, a business that she has done for the last four years. She wants to open another branch of her business in another town, Taveta. She also runs a car hire business in Mombasa. She has ambitions of opening more and more branches in the country. 

Pricilla learned of Milango through a friend, and since she was in need of credit she decided to join. She now seeks a loan to buy furniture and office equipment in Taveta. She shares that the challenge that she faces is that clients do not pay on time. The economy also affects her business. When her income stabilizes she will be able to pay her childrens' school fees. Her family will also have better living standards.

loans.use: to buy furniture and office equipment.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, who lives in Malindi, Kenya, has a poultry farm and earns additional income from teaching. As a farmer, he faces the challenges of competition and disease outbreaks. Poultry diseases are usually contagious, and a farmer might end up losing every other chick unless great care is taken. Daniel's ambition is to grow the business to the point that he can supply the whole town.

Daniel learned about Milango through an employee and decided to join to obtain credit. The recipient of a previous loan since repaid, he is now requesting a new one to increase his number of chicks. The loan will improve Daniel's business and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a batch of chicks

loans.name: Kaloli

texts.en:
Kaloli, age 35, earns an income from three different sources. His primary business is trading in agricultural goods, but he also grows coffee and operates a motorcycle rental business. With the combined income from these ventures, he supports his wife and their six children, who are between the ages of three and 15 years old. All six are attending school. Kaloli also supports one orphan and his brother's two children, whose parents divorced and whose mother left them behind.
 
He has been engaged in his trading business since 2003, selling his products to traders in the city of Kampala. He started this business in order to increase his income so that he would be able to pay his children's school fees. His greatest challenge is when customers who take products on credit take a long time to settle their debts.

He has acquired this loan in order to complete construction on his father’s house. He will use the profit he earns from his business to repay the loan.
 
He hopes eventually to expand his business and to purchase a car for transporting his products.

He describes himself as a hard-working  and trustworthy person.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials for finishing construction of an incomplete house

loans.name: Ana Lizeth

texts.es: Ana de 37 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, golosinas, refrescos, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda muy surtida, las personas la prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, como toda  buena comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Ana asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, age 37, lives with her partner and two children in their own home. She has a store where she sells basic staples; beans, milk, eggs, bread, candy, pop, and other items. She has had her business for many years, and this has given her sales experience that allows her to obtain a better income. Her store is located in her home. She has built up a good clientele because her store is well-stocked. People prefer her store and she stays ahead of the competition because she always has what her customers need. She always has quality products at accessible prices and provides unrivalled service. She is always ready to serve her customers. Like all good businesspeople, she wants to expand her business and make a new investment, but she needs capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy basic staples, candy, eggs, bread, drinks, etc.
Ana assures us that she will repay her loan, and she is certain that she will also provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, eggs, bread, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Viviana

texts.es: Sandra Viviana es una mujer de 29 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijas. Hace 8 años se dedica a la actividad de la confección, luego de haber laborado en varios talleres de confección como operaria y, gracias a la experiencia obtenida decidió montar su propio taller, donde confecciona todo tipo de prendas sobre medida, como pijamas, ropa deportiva, blusas entre otros, con lo que ha obtenido los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus hogar y sus hijas. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea comprar una máquina plana industrial, que le permitirá dar una excelente terminación a las prendas que confecciona y brindarle una mayor calidad a sus clientes; de esta manera podrá aumentar su producción y las ventas, que se traduce en mayores ingresos económicos. Su mayor sueño es hacer crecer su taller significativamente, que sea organizado y con la posibilidad de generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Sandra Viviana is a 29-year old woman who is married and has two daughters. She has worked as a dressmaker for 8 years, working first for dressmaking companies and then, thanks to the experience obtained, starting her own business. She makes all kind of tailor-made clothes, such as pajamas, sporting clothes, blouses, etc. and has obtained enough earnings to support his household and daughters. 

She's requesting a loan to the Corporation to buy a sewing machine that will allow her to give an excellent finish to the clothes and a better quality to her clients. She expects to increase production and sales and, therefore, also earnings. Her biggest dream is to significantly increase her studio, to have a well-organized business and to create job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet, de 34 años; reside en la casa que heredó de sus padres y donde vive desde que nació.Como una mujer del campo, ella se dedica a la agricultura; sus principales sembríos constan de café y plátanos. Los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder vender sus cosechas a los acopiadores que visitan la localidad, “no tengo que trasportar mi mercadería”, menciona. Además de recibir el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en diferentes terrenos agrícolas, ganando un dinero extra para el hogar. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero que le brindan para seguir adelante. Yanet, invertirá los S/.1500 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Yanet, age 34, lives in a home which she inherited from her parents. She has lived there from birth. She is from the countryside, and works in agriculture. Her main crops are coffee and banana, and she plants them on her own land. What she most likes about her work is being able to sell her harvest to the suppliers that visit the area; "I don't have to transport my merchandise", she says.
She also receives support from her husband, who works on different farms and makes extra money for the home. This is her fourth loan on Kiva and she is grateful for this financial support. Yanet will invest the 1500 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 39-year-old single woman, who has been working in a Laundry business for two years. Her Laundry service is located in a very good commercial zone. She is well known in her region, with a good reputation and special talents in her domain. It is her only source for living, that's why she has to keep on developing it as much as she can.

Zahra is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay what's left on a loan for her business machines and to buy a new developed one. Her business is going well, but not to the extent that she can pay everything she owes at the same time.

Zahra hopes that through future loans, she might move her shop to a wider one and hire employees to help her with the increasing number of requests she is accepting.

loans.use: to pay what is left on a loan for her machines.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con sus padres en casa de ellos,  ella se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, botones, etc. para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The borrower lives with her parents at their house. She works as a dressmaker and sells clothing items at the house. She's an incredible and exemplary woman, hardworking, responsible and optimistic. Many people give good references about herself and her work. She makes a wide variety of clothes at reasonable prices and of good quality, which is why many clients choose her. She has many years of experience and counts with regular clients. 

She has decided to request this loan to Integral to invest in her small business and buy the necessary supplies: fabrics, thread, elastics, buttons, etc. Her goal is to provide her clients with a better service, so that they will be willing to continue using her services, and to improve her sales and earnings. She expects to achieve her goal and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, elastics, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Aidee, de 46 años; está casada con Pablo. Ambos tuvieron 4 hijos, pero solo viven con una de ellos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Aidee se dedica a la venta de comestibles en una tienda que abrió en su hogar de  donde día a día obtiene los ingresos básicos para su hogar. Está actividad la hace sentirse una mujer desarrollada y además le gusta su trabajo porque puede dedicarse a su último hijo a quien desea brindarle una excelente educación.Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Aidee, en esta oportunidad invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de productos productos comestibles tales como arroz ,azúcar, leche , entre otros, los cuales son necesarios en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Aidee, 46, is married to Pablo.  They had four children but just one of them still lives with them in the house she inherited from her parents.  Aidee works selling groceries in a store she opened at home; she earns basic household income there every day.  This activity helps her feel fulfilled and she also likes her work because she can focus on her youngest child for whom she wants to provide an excellent education.  

This is her 4th Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue moving forward; she commits to make her payments punctually.  On this occasion, Aimee will use the 2,000 soles to buy food items like rice, sugar and milk, among others that are needed in her small business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: Luis reside en la ciudad de Guayaquil en el sector del suburbio, comenzó su negocio hace 15 algunos años vendiendo juguetes, con el tiempo fue añadiendo otros productos, actualmente vende todo lo relacionado a los artículos para el hogar, sus clientes se encuentran el los pueblos aledaños a la ciudad de Guayaquil, este préstamo lo destinara para invertirlo en los estudios de sus hijos menores de edad, su sueño es tener un local en el Mercado.
texts.en:
Luis lives in the Suburbio sector of the city of Guayaquil.  He started his business about 15 years ago selling toys and added more products as time went by.  He currently sells everything related to home items and his customers are located in towns adjacent to the city of Guayaquil.

This loan will be used to invest in his minor children’s schooling costs.  His dream is to have a sales spot in the market

loans.use: to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: Ernesto, de 19 años es un joven trabajador. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos en la casa de su madre. Desde muy joven le gusto mucho el estudio y siempre quiso apoyar a su familia y retribuir a su madre por todos los cuidados que le dió. Es así que cuando terminó el colegio sin demora estudio una carrera técnica muy corta que le ayudará a trabajar en una mina, donde ahora labora y trabaja sin descanso. Su tiempo es muy corto comenta que cuando llega a su casa después de varios días de trabajo tiene muchos compromisos, además de cuidar de su ganado, comprar todo lo necesario para que su madre los cuide cuando él se encuentra de viaje, pues la actividad a la que se dedicó desde joven es la crianza de ovejas de calidad y buena raza, las cuales comercializa a buen precio. Gracias al apoyo de su madre puede seguir creciendo en este negocio y espera seguir obteniendo más ganado y mejorar las calidad de sus ovejas y ser un buen ganadero. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA y agradece el financiero recibido para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Ernesto, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de ovejas para seguir aumentando su ganado.
texts.en: Ernesto is 19 years old and a hardworking young man. He lives with his parents and siblings in his mother's house. Since he was very young, he has liked going to school and he always wanted to support his family and pay his mother back for all of the care she gave him. That is why when he finished high school without delay he started a very short technical major that will help him work in a mine. That is where he works now tirelessly. He has very little time. he says that when he comes home after several days' work he has a lot of things to do. In addition to caring for his livestock, he buys everything they need so his mother can care for them when he is traveling. The activity he has done since he was very young is raising quality, well bred sheep. He sells them at a good price. Thanks to his mother's help, he can keep growing in this business and he hopes to keep getting more livestock and improving the quality of his sheep and be a good rancher. This is his first Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financing he is receiving. He is committed to making his payments on time. Ernesto will invest the S/.1500 soles in buying sheep to keep increasing the number of livestock he has.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio; este le permitirá comprar cinco quintales de maíz para la elaboracion de tortillas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar más su clientela y ha modernizado el local de su negocio; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Paulina needs to opt for a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing in the business; this will make it possible for her to buy five quintals of corn to make tortillas.  Her previous loan helped her increase her clientele and modernize her shop; her economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy five quintals of corn.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 45 years old, lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County. It is located by the sea and is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.
